dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlit illuminates the darkened stable, highlighting the  contours of a magnificent HORSE (PILGRIM) in surreal, dre like imagery: his legs, his muscles, his sheen, his mane. his eyes. He shakes his head and stamps his feet. He seem confined. Eager to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilgrim bursts through the stall and runs out the stables into a blinding white morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whiteness. Snow and sky without any discernible line betw Camera is POV, as if on the horse, riding through the  whiteness. Snow kicks up from the side. We hear the breat of the horse. As we travel on hills, through trees, we  experience of sense of wild, exhilarating freedom. We hear the giggles of a GIRL (GRACE) on the horse. An  occasional line;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, fly boy... that's it... go...  go... go... END OF DREAM as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace awakens, calmly. Takes a breath. Slides out of bed stands before a window, overlooking a beautiful Connectic country house. We see a snow-covered field and distant wo Grace presses her faces against the cold, frosted window  eager to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarm rings, ANNIE MACLEAN awakens. She shuts the alarm a scoots up in bed. She waits. Seconds later the television across the foot of her bed turns on from a timer -- to a 24 NEWS channel. INT. HALLWAY/ANNIE & ROBERT'S BEDROOM - MORNING Grace, fully dressed except for her boots, tiptoes past a partially opened bedroom door. Her father ROBERT is aslee alone, on his huge king size bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace is putting on her boots on a bench beside a back do She is wearing her mother's outfit. As she slides the boo on, we see behind her a row of framed photos -- Robert, G and Annie in happy times. She slaps a note on the refrigerator, with a magnet -- "G riding. Back around 10. Love, G."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace slips on her jacket and hat as she comes down the  steps, her feet hitting the walk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie's feet hit the ground, running -- her breath showin the cold air. She passes other joggers with ease. She cro the street and heads for an elegant CPW building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in running clothes, Annie opens the door and pick several newspapers that were delivered. She carries them the kitchen and sets them beside a huge stack of publicat magazines, papers, etc... Knowing she must read all of th some point, she breathes a disgusted sign. She thumbs thr the POST as she pours herself a cup of coffee. Something  catches her eyes and she snarls:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That little shit! She dials a portable phone and moves through the apartmen she talks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Lucy?... Did I wake you?... Have  you read the Post?... They've got a  little item about me and Fiske. He's  saying I fired him and that I faked  the new circulation figures.. Ha, ha...  Oh, please... It's the last act of a  desperate gnome... Set up a phone call  with Don Farlow for 9:30... Throughout the phone call, Annie is selecting clothes,  turning on the shower, undressing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snow has stopped falling. Grace walks along a hill, h in pocket. Spread out on the landscape are horses, on a h farm, standing like statues in the white covered fields. As Grace comes along the hill, we see another GIRL (JUDIT coming from the opposite direction. She doesn't have Grac lean elegance but her warm, friendly smile brightens her  face. Upon reaching her, Grace returns the smile with a h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's warmer than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go to a movie tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought your mom's coming up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (prickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? Judith immediately senses a problem so she continues casu as they begin walking away from Camera...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents are having friends from  college over. They're really nice...  They have this gorgeous son who wants  to be a forest ranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come? I'll start a fire... Judith laughs as they continue talking, their voices trai off, as the girls head for the stables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are several horses in their stalls. Grace and Judit enter, talking, carrying their English saddles. Judith st at a stall, disappearing into it as she says "Hello?"..., Grace continues to the end stall. Pilgrim (the horse from the dream) stands looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, beautiful boy. He's a massive figure beside her but she shows no inhibit She enters, touching his muzzle. He plays with her by nud her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop... Will you stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lead their horses, now saddled and ready, from the b Pilgrim tosses his head, prancing, playing with the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show-off. The girls mount the horses and ride off together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, casually dressed, enters the empty offices of her  magazine. She turns on the light, revealing a large row o stalls and glassed in private offices. Everywhere we look see indications of the kind of magazine she edits. She strolls to her office -- the largest -- surrounded by windows. The office walls are covered with photos, most o which are COVER STORIES ON ANNIE. (One photo is of Annie's father MARTIN. A BRITISH AMBASSA with his young daughter on his lap, her arms affectionate around his neck. Her mother stands right behind them, pos like a member of the royal family.) Annie sits and takes a breath. The only photo on her desk a family portrait, taken when Annie was given the Crystal Award -- Robert, Grace, herself and the Award. She checks watch -- it is almost 9:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WALK-IN CLOSET of the master bedroom; one side is Annie one side is Robert's. Robert stands before his bureau in the closet -- he has j showered and is putting on his watch and ring which lay  beside his cologne assortment. A FRAMED PHOTO OF HE AND A in India -- younger, vibrant, in love... when they first THE PHONE RINGS. Robert enters into the bedroom to pick u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? INSERT ANNIE: They speak in dulled, emotionless voices:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what, uh, what train are you taking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be in by two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You want me to pick you up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure... What's Grace up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riding with Judith. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about last night. I shouldn't  have brought it up over the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. We have to talk about it  and we're not always in the same place ... so... I just have to get used to it. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to do about dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. We'll figure it out. Pause. There is a lot unspoken but understood between the Annie's other phone line rings. Robert hears it as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. We'll see you later then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Bye. Annie picks up the other line and her manner brightens, h energy boosts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DON! My love, how are you? Did you hear  about Fiske?... No, suing is too  civilized. Can't we get your friend at Le  Cirque to serve him a fatal piece of  poached salmon?... Ha, ha... That's even  better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long Shot of the girls riding at an easy pacing, talking the time. Grace is an elegant rider, quite self-assured f 13-year-old... We come into the scene at the moment the  girls have just shared a secret or a fantasy. Judith is  giggling uncontrollably. Grace laughs as she says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Oh, come on! You think the same thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just could never say it! They stop at the end of the field, facing the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to go around by the  old road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we just cut through the  woods? Grace nods. They ride into the woods, continuing their ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls ride down, along a stand of hickories and popla to a RIVER. They stop the horses and their conversation, listen to the sound of the water. Below them, off in the  distance, they can just make out a two-lane country road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go down or stay along  the river?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We already did the river. Let's go down  and across the old bridge. We can circle  back. They begin to make their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie's office is now crowded with a dozen or so employee sitting on the couch, on the window sills, on the arms of chairs, against the walls... Paper bag emptied of bagels, cream cheese, orange juice, paper plates... Hand Held Camera captures the energy of the room as it  follows overlapping lines, laughter, etc... yet, no matte casual it all seems, Annie is very much at the center of  control... We enter the scene of LAUGHTER, as Annie asks  KEVIN, a feature writer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... So what did you say to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, thank you very much... (LAUGHTER, AD LIBS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really should do the interview... But  perhaps if you'd like to have dinner... LAUGHTER... Everyone starts Ad Libbing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner!!... He's so cute.... Why don't I  get those kind of interviews?... Look,  he has husband number eight written on  his forehead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right, all right... Kevin,  good job. Write the interview. If I don't  like it, you may have to sleep with her  for a follow-up! (laughter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now... I'm thinking about another fashion  designer spread... Who's news out there? Characters shout out designer names and comments as the p rings and LUCY picks up... speaking amdist the talking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. (presses hold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gottschalk. The room goes dead quiet, instantly. Then erupts in laugh as everyone realizes it. Annie, however, waves her hand a she takes the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet... Quiet! Everyone obeys. Annie presses SPEAKER PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone. Working overtime. Just for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you speak to Farlow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. We're suing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that absolutely necessary? It'll just  make it a bigger story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, he signed an agreement that he  wouldn't talk to the press and he's  libeled me by saying I faked the figures.  You're not going soft on me, are you? Silence. Gottschalk doesn't immediately respond. Everyone waits. Covert looks between characters suggest this is  interesting -- has Annie over-stepped her bounds with the magazine's owner? Annie waits without a shred of anxiety even though she might have some. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I suppose we could use another  good public feud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly... Everyone silently acknowledges Annie guts and influence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfectly still. We are looking down an empty TWO-LA ROAD covered with fresh snow. We see the girls slowly rid out of the woods, talking. They cross the road and start into the woods on the other side... They are trying to si LIZ PHAIR song, "CHOPSTICKS"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I met him at a party and he told me how  he like to drive me home... He said he  liked to do it backwards..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... I said it--"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... and I said that"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait, it just goes... "he said he  liked to do-"... Suddenly there's the SOUND OF THE METAL OF JUDITH'S HORSE scraping on some sheer ice hidden under the soft snow. Ju notices first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was -- The horse staggers... Judith looks to Grace --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace! The horse tries to find tracing with his hindfeet, kickin up sprays of snow and ice shards. The horse suddenly fall the ice and goes down hard on its knees...

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: The horse stumbles to get back on its feet, slipping agai Frightened, it rears and Judith, caught off balance, is  thrown, her foot catching in the stirrup...

dialogues.speaker: GRAAACE
dialogues.text: Her horse, unable to find its balance, starts to slide ba down the incline.

dialogues.speaker: PILGRIM, COME ON
dialogues.text: Grace, directly behind Judith, tries to turn Pilgrim to a being hit by the errant horse. What follows, we see from Grace's perspective. The detail that form the images and sounds of Grace's mind are fast, disembodies, almost surreal as -- Judith's horse bulldozes into Pilgrim, taking his legs ou from under him, sending both horses careening down the ic slope. Grace hangs onto Pilgrim's neck. Judith, her leg  helplessly tangled in the stirrup, is dragged, her head  bouncing on the frozen ground. They slide all the way back down to the COUNTRY ROAD. Pil is the first to find his legs and stand. Grace manages to up in the saddle. She sees Judith's horse stumbling back its feet, one of his legs broken at the ankles, walking i confused circles, dragging Judith -- her face bleeding, h leg hanging from the stirrup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly, crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay... I'm okay. She tries to extricate her leg from the stirrup. Grace sees it before she hears it. A GLINT off of steel. then hear the rumbling SOUND of a TRUCK coming around the bend... The Girls on their horses in the middle of the ro The Truck, an 18 wheeler carrying logging equipment, come around the turn... Grace grabs the bridle, trying to get  Judith's horse out of the road... The driver, seeing them on the air horn. The Horses bolt at the sound, the bridle slipping out of Grace's hand...

dialogues.speaker: JUUDE
dialogues.text: ... The horses turn apart. The Driver starts furiously  downshifting, trying to brake... He seems to get it under control when suddenly THE TRUCK SKIDS on some ice. It beg to slide, out of control, the truck bed and the cab jack- knifing. The truck literally plows over the helpless Judi and her horse -- the horse going down on the pavement, Ju disappearing under him. The truck's cab, like a mythic  monster, heads right for Grace and Pilgrim... Grace looks right into the Driver's helpless, frightened eyes... Sudd Pilgrim rears up at the truck, sending Grace flying, boun her off the pavement and under the wheel of the truck. Pilgrim instinctively jumps onto the hood of the truck, h hooves caught between the rear-view mirrors like some  grotesque ornament. His head and chest slams into the win shattering through the glass. And then it is still. The truck has stopped halfway in the road. Judith's horse lies in the road, motionless. Pilgrim, on the truck's hoo his legs splayed, stuck, his head and chest, bleeding. He shrieks, struggling to get to his feet. He manages to fre his legs and, stepping off the cab onto the road, walks o wounded, in pain, into the sanctuary of the woods... The Driver stumbles out of the cab, his head bleeding, in shock. He sits on the ground. All we hear is the sound of river and the wind in the trees. Grace, halfway under the truck, frozen, stares up at the  beautiful morning sky. WE HEAR THE SOUND OF A HELICOPTER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON GRACE'S NOTE on the refrigerator as Robert enter from the outside with two bags of groceries. He places th the counter near the PHONE MACHINE. He sees ONE MESSAGE i there. He presses PLAY as he puts away the groceries. A BEAT LATER the PHONE RINGS and he picks up, with the ma still playing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Paul, hi -- are you guys back?  How was it? Oh that sounds great. Oh  Paul.. hold on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on machine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert! Are you there?... Robert! It's  Liz!... Look, there's... there's been  an accident... Uh... Jesus... uh... As Robert listens, the voice of Liz's on the machine from inside, pulls his attention. On hearing "accident," Rober lowers the receiver, frozen, as he listens to Liz...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on machine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, just call me on my call phone...  1-917-449-7805...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilgrim is hiding in the shadows under an old railroad br standing up to his knees in the river. His chest is cut o bleeding. His face cut, contorted and swollen. LIZ HAMMON the local veterinarian, hides a hypodermic needle in her  jacket, quietly walking into the water. A Policeman is going into the water downstream from Pilgr whose chest is heaving, blood drips into the water. He  watches Liz. She is almost to him when suddenly he bolts, running upstream. The Policeman behind him shouts and waves his arm. Fright Pilgrim wheels back toward Liz, who manages to stick the in his neck. He rears, knocking her down, then runs out o the river, the hypo still in his neck. He runs for the  sanctuary of the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie sits on a train -- her laptop out, notes beside her her cellular phone, ever-ready. The train passes through  beautiful countryside but Annie is focused on an editoria she's writing. The train pulls into a station and stops, causing Annie t take a break and stretch her arms and neck. She looks out window for the first time and sees: A MAN, his hands in his pockets, waiting on the platform. watches as the Man holds out his arms to his two young  children, who are getting off the train. He picks them up his wife enters the scene, kissing him and wrapping her a around his waist. The children talk a mile a minute and t father listens to every word. Annie doesn't even realize she is staring. As they leave platform, she turns back to her laptop. As the train begi to move again, Annie returns to work. HER CELLULAR PHONE RINGS. She answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?... Hi. I made the 1:00 so... The expression on her face sinks into a stunned panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is running through the corridors, her bags in tow. sees Robert standing in the corridor talking to a DOCTOR. runs for them. When she appears, Robert and the Doctor stop their  conversation. Robert looks to Annie, who is waiting for n

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: Robert is teary eyed, beaten down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judith's dead. Annie's horrified, waiting for news of Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Grace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was in pretty bad shape. They've  done a C.A.T. Scan -- she has some  hemorrhaging...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But nothing we can't handle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surgery! For what-?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, her leg was shattered -- what  they call the distal epi.. epi..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distal epicondyle of the femur...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have to take the leg off. Annie responds without tears and cries but with a quiet  shock. We can tell her mind is racing, trying to process information, until finally she asks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which leg? The Doctor and Robert are surprised by the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What difference does it make? Annie stares for a beat, then nods apologetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilgrim is sedated, lying in his own blood in the snow,  surrounded by Police and trackers. He is being attended t LIZ HAMMOND, who is dictating to her assistant:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... His skull, cheek, and nose are  severely fractured. He has a deep  chest wound. I'm not even sure it  can be closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan, local accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal should be put down -- anybody can  see that. Liz looks up to him, resentfully, but knows he's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera moves from Grace's face down her body to Robert's  hand, which rubs her good leg. He looks at her lovingly,  pushing the hair from her forehead. Annie, needing to do something, tenderly straightens Grac blankets. It is plain to see where her leg had once been. Robert can't look. Annie, one to face her fears, bravely  looks at it head on. She notices the I.V. Bag and rises o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bag's almost empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's got a little left. They'll be  in to change it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she exits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, you leave it up these people...! Robert is about to respond but Annie is already out the d We hear the O.S. DIALOGUE as Robert listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, my daughter needs a new  I.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have her down, we'll be right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like it taken care of now please. Annie enters first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to keep on top of these people  or else they just sit on their -- But Robert is ignoring her. Facing Grace, smoothing away hair. He's giving her the silent treatment. Annie knows t means Robert doesn't approve of her dictatorial behavior. Annoyed, she turns away as well. The Nurse enters with a new bag and begins to replace the one as Robert backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tch. What are you -- Annie, about to respond to his inappropriate politeness, stopped by Robert, who finally looks at her. It's a power look that tells her to calm down and shut up. It's a look that, for all of Robert's sensitivity, affects Annie. She gets the message and stays calm. As the nurse leaves, Annie is about to say thank you, but Robert beats her to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Annie and Robert stand facing each other, when the PHONE Annie picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIZ HAMMOND on a cellular, walking away from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, it's Liz. How's Grace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (journalistic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her leg was shattered so they had to,  uh... remove it. She had some bleeding  but it's under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, Annie, I'm so sorry. I... I  know you're being hit with a low now,  I don't want to take too much of your  time but I have to talk to you about  Pilgrim. Annie hears the name as if it's some distant echo she can quite identify; Liz speaks quickly as Annie watches Grace breathing in her sleep --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not good. I've never seen an animal  with these injuries still breathing. I  know this is difficult to hear right now  I'd like your permission to put him down.  It's the really best thing we can do for -- That was too much information for Annie;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, uh, I, I don't understand. Start  again -- He's alive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but he's in a tremendous pain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course, right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We really shouldn't wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, Liz... (to Robert)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about Pilgrim... The Doctor pokes his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. MacLean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- put him down. She says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping, to Doctor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Hi. (to Annie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her you'll call her back. He exits with the Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz, listen, the Doctor's here and I  just can't, uh... talk now... so --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand, but Annie, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - See, what you can do for him --...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, no matter what I do, this horse  will never be the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I just don't know right now! Do  whatever you can and when Grace is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't right to make him suffer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I can say the same thing about my  daughter! But she is suffering! Can you  solve that problem! (Liz is quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't deal with this now, Liz! If you  need a yes or no right now, then no --  don't do it! Not until I know Grace is  all right. Now, please! Just do what you  can. Okay? (softer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Liz is stopped by Annie's almost pleading tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... They hang up. Annie takes a breath. Robert re-enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing new. He's just going off duty. Beat. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to get all the nurses'  names... It's good to know all their  names. Robert nods. But neither of them moves. They stand motion for a beat, then Annie begins to break down and eases her into Robert's arms. Robert embraces her, kissing her head, with an almost fat comfort. His expression tells us it's the moment he's bee expecting... and wanting. Now she'll be all right, in his Whatever distance between them, whatever problems felt  insurmountable last night on the phone, are now, for the -- for Robert -- gone. But Annie's expression tells us something different. Her  instinct to hold him was honest... but the effect isn't t same anymore. Something doesn't feel right. Something isn working anymore about his comforting embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should go get some of her things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, let me go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently pushing away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'll go. You stay... In case she  wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of recovery stalls with various sick and hurt anim Liz, exhausted asleep, on a chair outside a stall. There' slight scratching sound. A hoof against the stall. It get louder, awakening Liz. She gets up and looks inside the  paddled stall: Pilgrim is lying in the stall, heavily bandaged. He is wa up. His first instinct is to kick at the paddled stall wa He looks at Liz, his eyes filled with madness -- enraged still be alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie opens the door and enters, flicking on the light.  Camera is on her back, as she places a small suitcase on bed and opens it. She begins her task with cool efficienc Opening drawers and closets, assessing what should be tak what isn't necessary. Suddenly, she stops. She feels disoriented for a moment. can't remember the last time she was inside this room. Sh takes a moment to pause and actually look around. In the light, we now see more of Grace's inner sanctum. H riding prize ribbons in various colors adorn the walls.  Books. A girl's bureau cluttered with teenage possession  ranging from childhood toys to items that suggest a reach towards adulthood. Annie examines some items, affectionat A GOOD LUCK CHARM from India sits among her things. Annie takes it to pack in the suitcase. She notices a framed 8X10 of Grace sitting proudly atop  Pilgrim with Judith at her heel. She then notices the edg another picture behind this one, in the frame. She pulls Pilgrim photo out to reveal: An old 8X10 of Annie hugging Grace as a toddler. With her back to Camera, Annie rememb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is playing with toddler Grace. Chasing her around t room. Picking her and tossing her onto a small, toddler b Blowing into her stomach. Grace is laughing uncontrollabl

dialogues.speaker: END OF MEMORY
dialogues.text: Annie slides the Pilgrim picture back into the frame, the returns to her task of packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie enters. No one else is there. She places the suitca on a chair and opens it. She takes out the INDIAN LUCKY C and some horse books, and places them on her bedside tabl She takes care to prop up the Lucky Charm. She wets a cloth with some water from a pitcher and gentl wipes Grace's sweaty brow... INSERT VISUAL FLASHBACK HERE instead of in Country House. Annie then continues unpacking the suitcase. She opens  Grace's closet and sees a hospital bag filled with Grace' clothes at the time of the accident. Annie examines them discovers they are hers. Annie shoves the clothes into a and starts unpacking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Clock is ticking on the wall. The cafeteria is empty  except for one tired Intern, drinking coffee on a break. Robert and Annie are having a cup of coffee. In the silen they search for things to say. Until:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Judith's parents while you were  at the apartment... (Annie listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to say something... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I... I was so relieved that Grace  was still... that it wasn't our daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're very lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral's on Friday. He rises and crosses to the self-help coffee dispenser as continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh, I meant to tell you... Alex  brought that fabric over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on the table by the phone. I didn't  know what to tell him... (returns to table, sits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Whether or not we were... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... if we still we're thinking of redoing  the couch. Annie just nods. She senses Robert is looking for some ki of reassurance, but she can't give it to him. He continue

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And uh... Mario called about moving  the wisteria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Right. I'll call him. Pause. Annie looks at her husband as he stares off to the side, deep in his thoughts. She can sense he's sinking as fidgets with the napkins. She remembers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A younger Annie stands in a bathrobe, noticeably pregnant cooking at a stove -- reading instructions from a propped cookbook. FRANK SINATRA IS BLASTING as she sings along, i full voice, without inhibitions;

dialogues.speaker: HATES... THAT'S WHY THE LADY IS A TRAMP
dialogues.text: A younger Robert, wearing a suit, arrives home from work. her, he smiles affectionately. He puts down his briefcase bursts into his own playful Sinatra impersonation:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "She loves the free..." Startled, Annie turns around and smiles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sexily undoing his tie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a la fan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sing it to me, Frankie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a la Sinatra cool)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's my pregnant chick! She moves to him and they embrace... He wraps his arms ar her. They kiss. Annie laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can hardly get your arms around me.  How depressing. You're so early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to excuse myself from a meeting.  It's ridiculous. I kept thinking about  the baby... you... and, I swear, I was  going to start bawling right into my  briefs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loving it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw... that's so sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? Do you really? They turn to each other and kiss. END OF MEMORY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie and Robert sit silently at the table in an empty ho cafeteria, a lifetime later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room's lights are dimmed. Dawn is being to break thro Grace, slowly, opens her eyes coming out of sedation. She takes a moment to figure out where she is... to remember. She uses her hands to hoist herself up, but she's unstead and knocks into her bedside table -- knocking the Good Lu Charm from India off the table. It rolls under the bed, w a water tumbler. Grace never sees the Charm. Grace looks where her leg once was. She feels the blanket the empty space where her leg once was... just like her m did (did her father couldn't). Instead of self-pity, she' oddly fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daylight pours in. Robert and Annie enter. Robert, loaded with gifts, immediately crosses to Grace, on the side of good leg. Annie takes her position beside the lost leg.  Robert kisses his daughter;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, sweetheart... Annie's hand finds Grace's hand, and holds one of her fin tightly. Grace responds by wrapping her hand around her  mother's. They exchange a look of respect and gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you heard from Judith's parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Pilgrim doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz is taking care of him. (to change the subject)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor said the sooner you start  therapy the better the chances are you  can --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't even get out of bed yet! You're  already putting me in therapy!! Annie, slightly hurt, drops it as Robert takes over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor said whenever you're ready.  Take your time. You tell us... But he  thinks it'll only be a few months, then -- As Robert continues talking, Annie drifts to the Nurse.  Needing to manage something, she asks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get her fresh towels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A limousine drives up as the Doorman gets the car door. T weather is slightly warmer. People's clothing looks as if spring is coming nearer. Annie exits first, carrying a jacket for Grace. She is  followed by Robert, who immediately turns to help Grace. hear her O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! I can do it, OK?!

dialogues.speaker: OK, OK.
dialogues.text: Annie shoots him a disapproving look. We see Grace's good leg exit first... then two crutches,  followed by... a PROSTHETIC LEG. Grace scoots into view, takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all go ahead. I'll be up by  Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three sit at a dinner table, eating dinner. Grace pic at her food. Robert can't help staring at her. Annie eats watching them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want something else, honey?  We order something else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm just not that hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go lie down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to lie down. I've been  lying down enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to watch some television?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (edgy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... look -- just... Robert and Annie wait. She doesn't continue. She rises,  reaching for her crutches. Robert moves to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it! I got it! She exits into her room. Annie looks at him disapprovingl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie and Robert stand before their separate sinks, talki to each other through their separate mirrors, as they was for bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to stop doing that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helping all the time! Running to her  every time she trips or falls...  Anticipating her all the time. Robert shuts off his sink and dries his face, without a w He exits into the bedroom, and gets into bed. For a beat, stares up at the ceiling -- then says quite plainly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Annie, this didn't just happen  to you. Annie is applying moisturizer when she hears this. As it  sinks in, she doesn't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace stands by her door and can hear her parents muffled tense voices. Annie is angry at his complacency. Robert j wants what's best for Grace. She closes the door. Silence She puts her crutches against the wall and tries to walk  towards her bureau without them. It is a struggle, but sh does... almost falling, but grabbing the bureau just in t The 8X10 of her and Pilgrim, falls face down. She props i and looks at it -- focusing on her horse, then on Judith. Suddenly, she lashes out, knocking the photograph onto th floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you all right? Did something  fall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie pulls up in a Range Rover and stops. Grace moves fo the door. Annie asks respectfully;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want any help? Grace doesn't even bother to answer. She manages to get o the pavements, then turns for her bag... Annie notices other kids looking at Grace from behind, as enter the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad'll pick you up today, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Grace looks up to her mother. What is unspoken between th is the understanding that today will be difficult and the nothing either one can do about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be fine. Grace nods and turns to the school. Annie watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace makes her way through the hall. It is the first tim she has had to maneuver through a crowd. Some of the youn children are especially unconscious. Grace sweats her way through, trying to maintain her balance and her sanity. As Grace slowly moves along, whatever small faith she had that she could get through this day, begins to diminish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie moves about the office, hands in pocket, in front o her wall of windows. LUCY and her staff sitting around th office. Annie is speaking to a YOUNG WOMAN staff member;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what he told you! The  man's a liar! The man's an actor, for  Christ's sake. They're all liars!  They'll say anything to get a cover... The Young Woman looks insulted. AN ASSISTANT comes in to Annie a note;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is crossing an empty school yard. Grace is sitting the ground, her back against a wall, her "legs" in front her. She has been crying. She looks up to her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too hard. Annie kneels before her sympathetically brushing her hair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, honey... What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. I... I don't want to  come back, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, what are you going to do? You  have to go to school, honey. I mean, what --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not coming back! That's it! I want to  go home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, listen to me. Your body is just  healing. You have to give the rest of you  time as well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your version of a pep talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not staying home all day feeling  sorry for yourself. You're going to get  up and you're going to figure this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snotty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still early. What's your next class? With secret delight, Grace viciously utters the word:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gym!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is at her desk studying Grace's book on Horse Whisp Robert is on his bed with briefs laid out before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is closed. A SONG blares on her stereo. Grace is her bed watching a video of her and Pilgrim... riding at horse show. There's a shot of Annie standing proudly,  watching her ride. Another shot of her and Judith, both o them on their horses, waving to camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? Both Robert and Annie look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see Pilgrim. Robert and Annie exchange an anxious look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining. The MacLean car is parked by the barn. They are walking towards the stables under their umbrellas as runs to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... (to Grace)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so good to see you. How ya  doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's doing just grea. Aren't you  kiddo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, come on. He's out back now... (leads them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind how you go. It's pretty muddy back  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he in the back? Why isn't he in  the barn with the other horses? Liz stops, causing everyone to stop. She turns to face Gr realizing she doesn't know. She looks at Robert and Annie accusingly. She tries to explain:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Grace, you see... Pilgrim just...  isn't the same horse he used to be. (to the parents)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, maybe now's not  the best time to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really want to see him. Liz looks at Annie. Annie nods. Liz leads them on. They reach a row of empty old stalls. They cross to one o the stalls -- its doors are closed. Liz draws back the bo on top half of the door. There is an immediate explosion of sound inside the stall the sound of fear, startling them. Then it's still. Liz  slowly opens the door. Grace, with the aide of her cane,  walks to the stall. She hesitates, then looks in. It take moment for her eyes to grow accustomed to the dark. She s Pilgrim with his head down in the shadows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, beautiful boy... He lifts his head at the sound of her voice. Grace, and t audience, see him for the first time -- His mad eyes, his terrible disfigurement... Grace cries out, stepping backwards, nearly stumbling in mud... What is left of her horse are gone. Annie realizes what's happened and, together with Robert, rush to her... too see the monster Pilgrim has become and are horrified. Grace angrily pushes away from them and "runs" off. Rober goes after her. Annie is standing in the rain with Liz -- her eyes unable move away from the sight of Pilgrim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have told her, Annie. I  tried to explain to you how bad it was...  I guess you had to see it. But, there's  nothing to be done. This animal's beyond  help. Annie, can I have your permission  now to put him down? Annie stands in the rain, hands in pocket, fixed on Pilgr and more determined than ever;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone in her study, Annie sits before her computer search the Internet for information on HORSES -- Veterinarian  Journals, Therapies, Accidents, Eistories... We sense she been at it a while... She locates an ITEM TITLE -- HORSE WHISPERERS. Interested brings it up on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie sits in the huge reading room, books spread out bef her, under a green reading lamp. Her voice tells us what reading:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "It was in America that horses first  roamed..." In the books, we see pictures, lithographs, paintings and drawings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "A million years before the birth of  man, they grazed the vast empty plains of  grass and crossed to other continents  over bridges of rocks... They first knew  man as the hunted knows the hunter, for  long before man saw horses as a means to  killing other beasts, man killed them for  meat..." ANNIE'S V.O. CONTINUES OVER;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...The alliance with man would forever  be fragile -- for the fear he'd struck  into their hearts was too deep to be  dislodged... Since that Neolithic moment  when a horse was first haltered, there  were those among men who understood  this..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace sits alone in her darkened room, staring out the wi but not looking at anything. There's a discomforting dist in her expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... They could see into the creature's  soul and soothe the wounds they found  there..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hot, dusty fairgrounds horse arena. The worn wooden ble crowded. Lines of cars and pick-up trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...For secrets uttered softly into  troubled ears, these men were known as  The Whisperers..." One particular pick-up truck has its back door opened. A  MAN'S LEG is sticking out, putting on a pair of boots. A moment later the Man gets out of the car. Holding a cow hat, he has a certain quality, a self-respect, that men w know themselves seem to have. TOM BOOKER. A weathered redheaded woman named RONA -- late forties, s wiry horsewoman's build -- is walking towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, darlin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Rona. Sorry I'm late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know what to do if you were  on time. They walk together towards the fairgrounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fit? You want to check my teeth. (Tom laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good crowd today. I think you'll have  some fun. You going to stay for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's not too much trouble, I thought  I might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of trouble I'm in the mood for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-oh... Maybe I better get back in the  truck. Rona lets out a hearty laugh as they enter the horse aren

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the corral, a small black thoroughbred is being wo by Tom. As he rides and narrates into a radio microphone the crowd, we sense this is a man of good humor and great skill --  guileless, sensible, of the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It's always kind of interesting to  hear the horse's side of the story... The crowd laughs warmly. He directs his comments to a WOM wearing an expensive Ralph Lauren western outfit, standin outside the corral...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now if he was cranky or lazy, like you  say he is, we'd be seeing his tail  twitching there and his ears back,  maybe. But this isn't a cranky horse,  it's a scared horse. You see how braced  he is up around the neck back there.  He just doesn't know which way to turn... The Woman nods. Tom turns the horse on a dime so that he  always stays facing the circling thoroughbred...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see how he keeps pointing his  hindquarters in at me? Well, I'd guess  the reason he seems reluctant to move  out is because when he does, he gets in  trouble for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not good at transitions, you know?  When I want him to move from a trot to a  lope, say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sure that's what you think but  that's not what I'm seeing. You may think  you're asking for a lope, but your body  may be saying something else altogether.  You might be putting too many conditions  on him. For instance, you might be saying  "GO, but, hey, don't go too fast." He can  tell that from the way you feel. Your  body can't lie. You ever give him a kick  to make him move out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't go unless I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he goes and you feel like he's  going too fast, so you yank him back? (she nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And next thing you know, he's bucking. (she nods again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if someone told you to go, stop,  go, stop -- you'd buck too. The people laugh. The Woman smiles self-consciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a dance, see... Somebody has to lead  and somebody has to follow. Tom gracefully moves his horse around the ring, "dancing" then takes up a long coiled rope and throws it so that th coils slap against the black horse's flank, making it bur into a lope. And again... Making the animal go from a tro a lope, letting it slow, then up to a lope again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him to get so he can leave real  soft. He's getting the idea now. He's  not all braced up and tense like he was  at the start. He's finding out it's okay. He throws the rope again and this time the transition to lope is a smooth one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that? He's getting better  already. Pretty soon, if you work at  it, you'll be able to make all these  transitions easy on a loose rein. (sotto voce, wry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and pigs'll fly. (to Woman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to be okay -- so long as you  don't go yanking on him. She nods, but he can see she's upset, feeling foolish. He walks the horse over to her, turns off the microphone and speaks sympathetically:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the truth is it's all about self- preservation. These animals. (with great affection)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... well, they just have such big hearts,  you know? There's nothing they want more  than to do what you want them to do. But  when the messages get all confused, the  only thing they know to do is try and  save themselves... Now, why don't you go  saddle up and see what happens. Feeling better, and not a little attracted to his heartfe man's man, the Woman smiles and reaches for his hand to c over the rail. Her horse lets her come right up to him an stroke his neck. Tom comments;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't ever hold a thing against  you. They're the most forgiving  creatures God ever made. Turning on his mike and turning back to the crowd, he say

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, who's next? A Young Boy leads a mule into the ring. Tom smiles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now God has another idea entirely with  the mule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom has finished his "show." People are shaking his hand, thanking him, as he walks away from the corral, towards a trailer. The Woman in the Ralph Lauren approaches:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. He faces the Woman:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Dale. I just wanted to -- I can't  get over the way he felt under me after  you'd finish with him. Everything had  just, I don't know, freed up or something. The Woman is flirting. Tom shrugs, uncomfortably;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that'll happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you learn all this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What stuff is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About horses? I'd love to learn more  about it myself. Do you offer any  private lessons for riders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting the message)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Dale... you know, a lot of this  stuff... it just... nuts and bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if the rider's nuts, the horse  bolts. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the whole lesson right there.  You have a good day now... Just... keep  on freeing yourself up. He leaves her, entering the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, well-used trailer. Tom and Rona are finishing di like comfortable old friends. Rona rises, taking the plat into the kitchen and starts rinsing them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I clear forget. You had a call from  some woman in New York. She sounded  pretty wound up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't any woman in New York. But from  what I hear, most of them are wound up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The number's by the phone. He nods but doesn't move. He just looks at Rona and smile She's a good woman. But Tom hopes she doesn't want anymor than what they have together. Rona notices him looking an smiles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at, young man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long were you married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever miss it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does a horse miss a saddle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes. She chuckles, shuts the water off and crosses back to him sitting beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well as a matter of fact, I don't... most  of the time. She starts unbuttoning his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Rona, we weren't all that good  together even when we were good together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey... I was always good. Tom smiles as Rona leans in. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is looking over a magazine cover with Lucy and her She is unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it's perfectly shot, it's  perfectly cropped, it's perfectly laid  out and I'm so bloody bored, I'd rather  buy a Motor Racing magazine -- Start  over. Some general whines and groans as her assistant hands her note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, would you all excuse me a moment? She waits for them to leave as she sits before the phone. of her lines is lit:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An endless sky. An empty ribbon of two-lane highway in Ut A small roadside station. Tom's pick-up truck, his horse  trailer hitched to it, getting gas. Tom is on the pay phone. We hear Annie's voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Annie MacLean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Hello. This is Tom Booker. I got a  message you called. INTERCUT ANNIE in her office:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (efficient, expeditiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Yes. Thank you for calling back. Uh,  all right, let me try to explain my  situation as briefly as possible... You  see, my daughter had an accident with  her horse... They were both injured and  she, my daughter, she hasn't been able  to... fully... uh... It was an extremely  traumatic experience... and uh... Tom, sensing her turmoil, listening compassionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went on the Internet and found this  article about you... It says you're a Horse  Whisperer, that you... you help people  with horse problems. And you have quite a  success rate when it comes to traumatized --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, see, truth is, ma'am, I help horses  with people's problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know, however you want to put  it -- I got your information from the  publisher of the article. I called  Montana and your sister-in-law, I think,  gave me this number. (trying to be charming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm been hot on your trail you could say  because I was hoping you'd consider  coming to New York and taking a look at  my daughter's horse and possibly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, I'm very sorry about your problems  and I appreciate what your daughter must  be going through, but I'm afraid you've  misunderstood whatever it is you read. I  don't do that sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you could just come for the day.  New York's only a few hours by plane,  I'd have you home by dinner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, even if it was nearer, that's just  not what I do. I give clinics. And I'm  not even doing them for a while. I'm  heading back to Montana right now. I got  a ranch to take care of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts, abruptly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pay you for your fare. I'll send you  to Montana first class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, first class to Montana is a waste  of good money. Now, am I being too polite  here or when I say NO in Utah, does that  mean YES in New York City? Annie is taken aback. Tom feels badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, I don't mean to sound insensitive. I  understand your situation. But there's  nothing I can do. You just called the  wrong person, that's all. I hear there  are a bunch of therapists in New York.  Maybe you should call one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Booker, if I could just ex --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am very sorry, ma'am. Goodbye now. He hangs up before Annie can continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie reaches for Grace's bedroom door, then pauses. She  realizes she should knock. She does and whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace? (knocks again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, it's mom. Annie slowly opens the door. She finds Grace's bed empty. looks over to the window to find Grace sitting in a chair the dark, looking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace. What are you doing? Not looking up, Grace speaks in a hollow voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find that charm Daddy gave me  from India.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought it to you in the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, I put it on the table near your --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apathetic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you decided about Pilgrim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... how you feel all right about  telling Liz to put him down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should. It's not fair to let  him suffer. He's not much use anymore.  He'd hate living like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's... very compassionate  and... mature way of looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they should put me down too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I'm not much use anymore. Why  can't they be compassionate to me? What frightens Annie most is the calm and apathy in Grace voice. She's surrendering... Annie, for the first time in long time, feels she's losing control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie sits alone at the kitchen table, nursing a glass of wine. Robert enters and sits opposite her, wearing a tuxedo -- tie and collar undone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was the dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All our "favorite" people were there  saying all their "favorite" things about  their "favorite" subjects. I thought to  myself, we've been friends with these  people almost twenty years and nobody  knows anybody. We're so afraid we won't  like each other and have nobody go to  dinners with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still our friends, Annie. It's  nothing serious. You kid about them all  the time... And I could tell Paul really  appreciated me being there. He drinks Annie's wine as she looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get a hold of that horse guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Robert nods. Accepting. Silence. Annie sips her wine. The

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking... Maybe we should think  about the three of us going someplace  warm... Remember that house we rented in  Bermuda... The pink one with the -- His arm accidentally spills the wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. As he bends down to wipe it up with a napkin, Annie watch Robert clean the spill. Something about his movements, hi posture -- a sense of weakness, of surrendering, of not h the inclination to fight, of just accepting and smoothing over the rough sports -- strikes her hard. Annie realizes love she feels for Robert isn't fading. It's gone. He finishes cleaning and sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was I saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About us going someplace warm...  Someplace Grace'll have to wear shorts  or bathing suits or summer dresses... Robert looks at her and realizes it's a bad idea. He nods again, getting the message. Silence. In that silence, Ann looks at him... and makes a decision:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, I want to take Pilgrim out to Mr.  Booker. Drive him out to Montana... With  Grace. Robert is confused... and a little worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. You just said he  said no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did, but... I think I can change his  mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the craziest thing I ever heard.  Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, Grace isn't adjusting to school.  And she can't sit in this apartment all  day... I think it would be good for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at a loss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! What are you -- you're serious about  this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've called Liz. They can set me up with  a trailer for Pilgrim. I thought we'd  stay at motels along the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've already made arrangements!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I was just researching. Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come home and you tell me we're going  to drive a psychotic horse to Montana! I  can't just pick up and leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not asking you to. I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to do this by yourself? How?  You can't take care of Pilgrim all the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be sedated. I know horses, Robert.  I'm the one who taught Grace how to ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... Bo-... What about the magazine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in charge. I went back very soon  after the accident. They didn't expect me  for a couple of months. I'll just take  that time now... I can still oversee  things from Montana... Take my fax...  My computer... Beat. Robert fears this is about the marriage. Yet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's, uh... No, I really don't think  it's a good idea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searching)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her psychiatrist... said... she needs  security now... stability...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't say he's been all that effective  with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a psychiatrist? He said it takes  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what he says! We have to do  something, Robert! I can't sit here and  trust everything's going to work out just  by pretending it will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not pretending anything! Beat. Robert just stares at her. He looks concerned... al worried. Annie gets uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? It is very difficult for Robert to say;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought... well, ever since the  accident, I just thought we... He stops. Annie knows where he headed and prays to God he doesn't continue. He doesn't. A thick silence hangs betwe them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really wish I could understand why  you think this is so necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, we're losing her. We're losing  her. (he listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what the doctors say. The  truth is, they don't know anymore than  we do -- less, when it comes to Grace...  This may not sound sensible or... logical,  but nobody's suggesting anything better.  I can't explain it, Robert. I just have  this feeling... this annoying... bloody  feeling that if... if, somehow, Pilgrim  can be made all right... then so can Grace.  I just know it! Robert can feel the strength of her will. He can find no around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if she doesn't want to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She will if you think she should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think it's best if I don't come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's not what I said. I'm not a  dictator. If you feel you should come,  then come. Just do whatever you think  is right. At some moment, they realize Grace is standing at the ent to the kitchen. They are surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going! I don't care what she  says! Annie lowers her head. Robert stares at Grace as she walk him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?... I don't want to go. Grace stands next to Robert. He holds her hands. Annie lo at him, without sympathy. Robert looks back. In his face the total acceptance of what must be. As well as the sadn of it's inevitability. He looks back at his daughter, who eyes have never left him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilgrim is being loaded into the trailer by four strong s men, violently kicking and pulling all the way. Annie watches with anxiety -- an almost giddy Liz by her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should give him another  sedative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problem is, there aren't many  volunteers. He's already had enough  to sink a battleship. You have a  pin, just in case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably best. You may want to shoot  yourself half way to Ohio. In the back seat of ANNIE'S SUBURBAN sits Grace -- her ba the action. Hearing Pilgrim's struggle. Putting her walkm on her ears and raising the volume... We hear -- GRACE'S MUSIC, ON THE SOUNDTRACK, bringing us to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie's Suburban drives along Route 80, pulling the horse trailer behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, in the back seat, wearing her headphones, listenin her music (maybe LIZ PHAIR OR HOLLY COLE). Detached. Non- committal. As trucks pass by, their time slapping the pav she reacts and turns to the other window. Annie, in sunglasses, shifts her attention between the ro and her rear-view mirror -- checking on Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Suburban drives as the sun begins to set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Suburban and Horse Trailer are parked in the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small furnished motel room with two twin beds. Grace sits up in bed watching TV, with no expression. A s with canned laughter serves as a hypnotic drug. Annie enters from the bathroom, after showering, drying h hair. Grace doesn't bother to look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to take your bath? (Grace shakes her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get up early tomorrow. You  may not have enough time to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine -- I'll take my bath. She begins moving off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't mean you have to. It's just  that we may not have enough --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- enough time tomorrow. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if you want to take it in the  morning, that's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts on "fine")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. Annie realizes she may have pushed too hard, but she also realizes there's no talking to Grace now. So, she achieve her goal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it now. Grace hobbles off the bed, enters the bathroom and shuts door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are off. Annie lays in bed, wide awake. It is middle of the night. Grace, asleep in the other bed, begins whimpering. She's  having a bad dream. Annie rises -- considering whether or to intercede... Finally, Grace begins to cry out... softl first, but with increasing intensity until she awakens in fear... Annie appears right by her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, sweetheart? What? Shaken, Grace cannot fight how much she needs her mother that moment. She wraps her arms around her, tightly, and to catch her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sleeping in a strange bed,  that's all. Happens sometimes. It's  Ok. It's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Suburban continues its journey. Once again -- Annie, in the front, and Grace, in the rear drive without a word between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Annie occupy their same positions. Annie is on car phone with her office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, listen -- let's do this. When  I get to the next motel, I'll see if  they have a fax. If not, I'll call  you tomorrow to -- Annie continues O.S. when we hear a shifting, a rocking i the trailer behind them. As if Pilgrim made a sudden move Grace quickly turns her head. Annie looks in the rear vie Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh Lucy, look, I have to go. OK...  Later. Annie hangs up and smiles at Grace through the mirror. Gr reaches for her walkman and headphones. Annie offers;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace! GRACE! Grace lowers one side of her headphones;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to put your music on  up here? Grace shrugs. Annie shrugs it off as well. Grace replaces headphone. Annie turns on the radio -- nothing but countr gospel or religious talk shows... She shuts it off. Frust Annie looks up ahead and sees:

dialogues.speaker: A TRUCK STOP DINER
dialogues.text: Annie yells to be heard through the headphones;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Annoyed, Annie pulls onto the gravel and stops, talking t herself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine! She exits the car, banging the door. As she walks acrund car to help Grace, she talks to herself in a sarcastic wh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Whatever you want!" Well, this is what  I want. I want to eat lunch and I want  to smoke a cigarette and I want to keep  talking to myself for the next two  thousand fucking miles..."! She opens Grace's door. Grace senses her mother's anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie and Grace enter. They look around: Formica floors, truckers in caps and beer bellies stuffed into booths or at the counter. There is not a single spac available. Annie and Grace stand near the entrance. Another Trucker  enters and they step aside, huddled together in this fore land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Annie enter the room to find A DOUBLE BED inste of two twins. Neither comments. Annie exits O.S., carrying the bags inside, as she says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should call your dad before it  gets too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already did. (Annie's surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This morning. When you went running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. You didn't tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know I had to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares angrily, speaks  softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't. Silence. Annie exits past her to the car.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Grace is asleep in her twin bed. Once again, Annie is wid awake. The clock reads: 4:55 AM. But Annie can not sleep. Camera moves away from Annie, past her side of the bed, t the other side of the room. WE SEE THE SHADOW OF A WOMAN coming towards the bed. She  comes in camera angle and we follow to her back to the be which has now transformed into --

dialogues.speaker: WE ARE IN MEMORY.
dialogues.text: The Woman gently shakes little Annie awaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie... Annie, sweetheart... wake  up. The little girl, with sleep in her eyes, turns and sees h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad news I'm afraid. Your Daddy's  gone. END OF MEMORY. Annie, in present time next to Grace, thinks of this as s stays awake. Putting her jogging parka on over her nightg she goes outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses the motel parking lot to the horse trailer. S looks in through the siding at Pilgrim, checking on him. sees he is caught his halter on the side of the van. She  crosses to the trailer door, hesitates, then opens it.  Pilgrim looks at her. Gathering her courage, she climbs  inside. He is still, looking at her. She carefully frees halter. And suddenly he bares his teeth, biting at her. S stumbles back out of the trailer, slamming the door shut. stands leaning against the trailer -- wondering if she's of her mind for attempting this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
