dialogues.text: The right pedal is gas, the other  one's the brake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I can with my leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's only one way to find out. (puts truck in gear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it a little gas. She awkwardly puts her prosthetic foot on the gas pedal. much. It lurches forward. She takes her foot off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we know you can. Now you just  got to feel how much. Try it again. She does. They slowly, very slowly, move along the dirt r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice, real nice. There's a little  road down at the end here, turn onto  it. Grace badly oversteers, but makes the turn. She drives al the road, across a pasture, heading toward distant mounta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just follow this. Nothing to it. I'm  going to shut my eyes here for a  little while. Just keep going till  you run out of road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (afraid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a question of if you can -- you  are. Just keep your eyes on the road  and your foot on the pedal and the  rest will take care of yourself. Folding his arms over his chest, shutting his eyes, Tom  relaxes back. Grace locks her hand on the steering wheel her eyes straight ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck is parked at the foot of a mountain. Grace, ver pleased with herself, sits beside Tom on the cab's roof,  looking around them at the great Montana. After a beat;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get Pilgrim from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We bought him in Kentucky. My mother  and I took a trip down there to see  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must have been pretty special. Grace nods. It is a pleasant memory. He motions for her t quiet. An old ELK with a prodigious rack of antlers, has down out of the mountains. Seeing them, he stops in his  tracks, dead still. They watch each other. Then the elk t and runs back up into the mountains. Tom smiles at Grace smiles back -- partly because of the elk, partly because alone with Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid of anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting old. Not being of much use,  I guess. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What went on out there, Grace? With  Pilgrim? Grace doesn't say anything. Tom nods then;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, Grace, I've got a problem.  When I'm working with a horse, I like  to know its history. Now, most times,  the horse can tell you pretty much the  whole story, but sometimes he can be  so messed up in his head that you need  more to go on. You need to know exactly  what went wrong. Often times, it's the  obvious thing, but something that went  wrong just before that, maybe even some  little thing... Grace is quiet. She doesn't want to think about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like if I'm driving and run into  a tree. When somebody asks me, "Well,  what happened?", I don't say, "Well,  I plowed into a tree." I'd say, "The  sun was in my eyes." or "I skidded." or  "I took my mind off the road for a  second." See what I mean? (Grace nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you feel about talking  about it and I can understand you might  not want to. But if I'm going to figure  out what's going on in his head, it'd  sure help if I knew exactly what  happened that day. Grace looks away. Tom smiles and gently puts his arm arou her shoulders, which has a soothing effect on Grace -- ma her feel safe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today -- whenever you feel like it.  I leave it up to you. Grace looks into Tom's eyes, wanting so much to unburden to him and have him make everything all right. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is making his way to the house at the end of the day, he stops and looks over to the Creek house -- POV -- the lights are on. And he can see Annie, exhausted approving pages, talking on the phone and faxing all  simultaneously. He gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie sits on the porch of the creek house, with a guilt herself, sipping coffee and deep in thought. She looks up see: Tom riding towards the house on his horse, leading anothe horse behind him. He looks to her and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (murmurs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-oh. Tom reaches the house as Annie rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer's no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't heard the question yet. Truth  is, you'd be doing me a favor. I got all  these eager young colts need riding and  poor old Rimrock here is feeling kind of  left out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd be grateful, he'd take real good  care with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this how you're going to make me pay  my phone bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, ma'am, I'm afraid that's extra. She gives him a crooked smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, in Levis and a jacket, rides Rimrock beside Tom ac the pasture. We overhear them in the midst of talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax our center... It's just sitting  in a bucket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's been a while, but I... I  remember the basic ideas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. I'll stop talking then. He rides a few steps ahead as Annie realizes she doesn't  remember. She just went into automatic "I don't have to b told anything" mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I never rode Western. I'm  sorry. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he don't know that. Just sit the  horse. (watches her ride)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good... You have a nice seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look all right. You want to pick  it up a little?

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: Tom urges his horse into a center. Annie canters alongsid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your reins, he'll go with you,  give him some room, let him do the  work. Relax, don't grab him with  your thighs, just so long as he can  feel your body. Annie responds to every suggestion without resistance. An she experiences this sense of pleasure -- this great anim beneath her, the physicality and the surrender of letting someone else lead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to let it go some more? She begins to let herself go, losing herself in the exper She just nods... Tom breaks into a full gallop... Annie f suit... She lets everything go -- her job, her marriage,  motherhood, guilt, anxiety... all of it. Her only focus i horse beneath her, and the man on the horse leading her..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ride along the creek, crossing at a ford. They ride towards the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ride through a narrow pass with sheer rock walls, ri by a waterfall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ride across a meadow, cattle stepping lazily aside t let them pass. And as they ride alongside each other,  appreciating the silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ride up along a sloping ridge covered with pine tree They come to the rim of a high bluff. They stop. They loo out at the twin valleys that gave the ranch its name. And they can just see the old CREEK HOUSE hidden in the shade some trees along the creek... Tom looks over at Annie, who is looking out over this  beautiful vista.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a whole other world you have  going on here. It just goes along,  doing what it has to. And you're a  part of it, you just wake up and,  and there you are... And everything  that seems like life or death some  place else -- doesn't affect any of  this one bit. Tom is impressed by her feelings. He sees her saddle cinc needs fixing and gets off his horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lift your leg. Annie complies once she realizes what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long did you live here with your  wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years. My son was born here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opens her eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I haven't seen him in a while. He  used to come to the ranch over summers,  but then he started having friends and  was going off to college, so... Good boy.  Hal. Lives in New York near his mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you meet her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: College. In Illinois. She was playing  the cello. I hadn't heard cello music  growing up. She had the reddest hair,  the bluest eyes. When she played, it  was... Tom can't find a beautiful enough word. But Annie underst

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was the most beautiful thing I'd  ever seen. Annie sees Tom as if with new eyes -- his love for this w he lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't it work out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was never really happy here. She did  the best she could. Annie looks at him and for the first time senses a kinshi an understanding they both have of being torn between two worlds... a desire for home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace told me you have a country house  in Connecticut. Sounds like a beautiful  place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. It's lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever think of moving there full time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did at one point. When we thought  we'd have more children. And we after  tried. We tried everything, but...  wasn't meant to be. There is an awkward silent beat for a moment. Annie is  momentarily self-conscious. Tom helps by speaking of hims

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear that! See, I knew she was never  going to be a ranchest, but I wanted  to try -- I thought maybe she'd give  music lessons to the kids in town or at  the school, maybe even recitals. My son  would grow up here. Maybe have one or  two more. I'd teach 'em what I could.  They'd play with my brother's kids. All  grow up together. And even if they all  decided to go out into the world, they'd  always know where home was -- cause we'd  keep it for 'em...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very important to you, isn't it?  Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think it is. And I don't mean  everybody's got to be married, have kids -- It's more like, knowing where you're  from, where you belong, what feeds you,  where you can go no matter what happens...  Knowing what you're supposed to be doing  while you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you find out all that? Tom looks right into her eyes and confesses without a shr of self-consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got lost. They smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world is in silhouette. Off in the distance, we see T standing by his horse, offering his hand to Annie, helpin her off. There's an awkward moment, neither of them wanti the day, or the moment, to end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace is standing by the window, looking out at them. The movements indicate an intimacy that upsets her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat; Tom gets back on his colt. He takes Rimrock's reins and l him off. Annie stops for a moment, watching him ride away She watches her mother walk towards the house;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace watches her mother stand there a moment, then turn walk towards the house. Grace moves away from the window, her emotions churning -- jealousy, anger -- and enters he bedroom, shutting the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, hat tipped low, is riding his horse, leading some yo horses, exercising them in the morning pasture. He sees G walking with her cane, coming across the pasture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... She stops. After a beat;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you let me ride your horse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you talked to Tom about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... You sure Tom said it's  all right? She nods. He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to give me a hand or  aren't you? He gets off his horse and holds it. She puts down her can then puts her hand on the saddle horn. She puts her  prosthetic leg into a stirrup. Frightened, she starts to  shake;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? Angry, determined, Grace tries to swing her leg onto the  horse. She can't do it. Tears of frustration on her face. tries again. She manages to pull herself halfway on, her  prosthetic leg buckles and she falls. Frightened, Joe run her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? She gasps to catch her breath. He reaches to help her up. pulls her hand away. Embarrassed, she "runs" off. Joe rem still. He hears a little VOICES. He turns and sees the TW having been watching the whole thing from a small hill. A they run off, he yells, threateningly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better not say anything!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Joe running towards the creek house, fastening good shirt. He's dressed and cleaned for dinner. He's lat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is in the midst of making a spaghetti dinner. She's little frazzled but she's on top of it. Grace enters wear a lovely dress -- it is the first time we have seen her i dress. Annie hears her enter before she sees her, asking;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, would you see if anybody  wants -- Annie notices Grace standing there, in her dress. She sto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look really pretty. Grace is a little self-conscious but grateful. She begins taking forks out of her dress pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought there were too many forks  on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, one was for salad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, they don't mind eating with one  fork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks, then;)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. Good. Grace puts them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anybody out there want  something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, honey. Grace nods and exits to the living room.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: The room is silent because every Booker is READING A  DIFFERENT COPY OF ANNIE'S MAGAZINE. Frank covertly glimps at the scantily-clad models... The Twins sharing a magazi doing the same thing as their father, but keeping an eye for mom... Diane is looking at pictorial exposes on the k of lives she only hears about on audio tapes... Tom sits off to the side, amused by the sight. Grace enters as Joe enters. They nod across the room to e other with a little smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would anyone like something to drink? We hear a CRASH in the kitchen, then:

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: Everybody looks up for a minute. The Twins giggle. Diane them a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give your mom a hand. Diane watches him enter the kitchen, then returns to her  magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie has dropped a hot pot into the sink, after pouring tomato out of it, and into a terrine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything under control?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. I'd forgotten how long  it's been since I've done this. And  I couldn't get any Parmesan cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just make yourself comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha, ha... all right, well, uh I guess  you can bring out the pasta. She undoes her apron and crosses towards the bowl. Tom's never leave her. It's the first time he's seen her in her dress, sans apron. As she lifts the bowl to hand to him, realizes he's been looking at her. There's a silent momen then;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? She looks for it. Tom crosses to her and buttons it, then takes the bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. They're quiet for a beat as they exchange a look. Suddenl Grace enters -- she clearly doesn't like the two of them alone, Annie quickly covers;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good, Grace, would you bring in  the bread... I'll get the salad and  then we're all set. Tom has already exited by the time Annie finishes, and Gr grabs the bread basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We parachute into the middle of the meal. The spaghetti i hit... We cut to different conversations and reactions ar the table. Frank is in the middle of saying;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd be a whole lot easier to pay  the feed end of the month...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think Warren would go for that. Grace is talking to Joe and the Twins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... like, for instance, you can go on  the Internet and access this thing  called The Visible Man -- who was this  murderer they caught in Texas that was  executed and donated his body to  science and you can call him up on the  screen and dissect him, like in Three-D... Grace eats as she talks. Joe and the Twins are fascinated Annie asks Tom, Frank and Diane;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, did you ever think about hiring  a business manager?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a business manager. The best  around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane takes care of the books. I don't  know how, but at the end of every  month, everything adds up to the penny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't brain surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty impressive. Where I come  from, you'd be a gold mine. Diane doesn't know how to accept that, but inside she's  bursting with pride. She focuses on the Twins who fight;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is MY fork. That's YOUR fork, ya  idiot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. You stop that kind of talk at the  table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have another round of that  spaghetti if may?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. I made enough for an army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I uh... I like the sauce very much. Maybe  I get the recipe. Annie is so pleased and is about to reply, but Grace, not Tom smiling at Annie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from a jar. There's an odd silence as a deflated Annie serves Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Finally, Diane saves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I tried jar sauce once --  wasn't this good. Ya gotta know  which brand to buy. I'd like to  get the name of this one. Annie is grateful. Grace feels foolish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we see the dead body on the  screen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just my computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Grace, show them. I'm going  to put the coffee on. I made an apple  tart for dessert. The Twins excitedly move to the computer. Joe waits for G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll help you with the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I know I should reject that  offer, but I'm not going to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jovial)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reason you should, no reason you  should. They exit into the kitchen. Frank continues eating. Tom looks around -- Grace showing the boys the computer. and Diane in the kitchen. For a second, we see Tom realiz image of the life he once thought he could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Diane and Annie prepare coffee and dessert;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was looking in one of your magazines  and saw that picture of the couple  getting married at the Pyramids. Were  you ever in Egypt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was there for that shot, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God -- I think it was the fourth  or fifth time I'd been there, so all  I remember was the heat and how  incompetent the photographer was... She laughs as she directs this last line to Diane, who ju smiles. And Annie realizes that's not what she meant at a This woman is starving for glimpses into this other life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, uh, Egypt is, well, it's like  nothing else. It's like going back in  time. (Diane listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember as a kid trying to imagine  what a kid my age, centuries ago,  walking over that same ground, was  wondering about or, if they had the  same problems as me... and I felt,  connected to... to time itself, almost.  Ha, I never realized how hard it was  to describe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to go there one time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Frank ever take a vacation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon. We're going to Branson, Missouri  to see my cousin Emma married. Frank  loves in there. Annie can sense the disappointment in her voice, and at t same time, the comfortable resignation. Suddenly, from inside, they hear LOUD OVERLAPPING VOICES the children fight.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Diane and Annie enter to find Joe and Scott fighting, as tries to break them up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys! Settle down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never let me have a turn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be such a baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just showing off for her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut up, stupid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who's stupid -- letting  her go and fall off your horse!! Everyone goes quiet, except for the computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw 'em. In the pasture. Her trying to  get on Gonzo! I saw 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you go riding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little shit! Joe lunges for Scott and the two start rolling in a fight Frank and Tom work to pull them apart as Diane yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, I'm so sorry, but they're just  tired. We'll have dessert another time.  Frank, get them out of here. (to other Twin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Say good night and thank  you... Voices everywhere. Yelling. "Thank you's!!" During which, Grace quickly turns and exits. Annie eyes follow her out the room, but with her guests and the chaos, she doesn't whether or not to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner was delicious. Thank you. (to Twins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say thank you!! Diane and Frank usher the kids out. Tom holds onto Joe un they're gone, then lets him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, ma'am, I thank you for dinner.  It was very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Grace try to ride, Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expect you should talk to Grace about  that, ma'am. And if I did anything  wrong, then I am sorry. Ever the gentlemen, Joe exits. Annie looks to Tom. He's a to leave, when he stops and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let her turn you away. Tom exits. Annie stands and faces Grace's closed door. Slowly, she  lowers herself to her knees and sits on them, thinking... reminiscent of Tom, waiting for his moment with Pilgrim, the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know how long Annie waited, but she knocks gentl then enters to find Grace, in her nightgown, on her bed, the night stand light on. Her prosthesis is against the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace? Is everything all right? (no answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you tried riding again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snotty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Does that mean I'm cured?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, nobody's trying to cure you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You worried everything all right  now and we'll have to go home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... not wanting to go home because  you hate daddy so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, I don't hate your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't remember the last time you  made him dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just trying to say thank you to  Diane and Frank and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom? Annie sits by the bed, Grace moves away a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I just wanted to say, I think  it's great you're riding again.  And... and I think I know why you,  you needed to do it alone... without  anyone knowing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know everything!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STOP IT! Why can't I talk to you!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO, YOU STOP IT! Stop pretending like  you care! Like this really isn't about  you and Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT?! How can you -- (at a loss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if my friendship with Tom  bothers you so much, but I happen to  value having someone to talk to,  especially when my own daughter  ignores me night and day because no  matter what I say, it's wrong and no  matter what I do, it's wrong... I'm  sorry I'm such a disappointment to  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now you know what it feels like. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't deserve that. I have never  looked at you as a disappointment. If  I'm on your back to do better, if I  push you to try harder it's because  I want you to be the best you can be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOR YOU! Because I'm your daughter  which means you're the best mother!  Isn't that what you're always talking  about in interviews -- having it all,  the great career, the great family...  Proving everybody wrong. Wanting  everybody to think you're this perfect  woman! Beat. They're both exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, if... if there's a part of you  as parent that... that takes pride in  your child -- that, you can look at  them and see something you've  accomplished as well... if that's wrong,  then I'm sorry. (no answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it wasn't my intention. I don't push  for me. I do it for you... So you don't  waste half your life feeling like you  don't know where you belong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you've done a great job. Beat. Annie feels deeply hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then I do apologize... But what  I'm most sorry for is turning you  into a spoiled brat who can only  think about what she's feeling... who  can't admit when she's wrong and who  can't forgive when she's not.

dialogues.speaker: LEAVE ME ALONE
dialogues.text: Annie stops to exit as Grace says something under her bre Annie stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said... I started. Grace starts to sob. Annie doesn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Started what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When? Tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt it happen downstairs and when  I went into the bathroom. Annie reaches down to touch Grace's shoulder. Grace turns there is no anger in her face. Annie sits and takes her i her arms. Grace clings to her and sobs like a little girl Annie sees tears run -- gratefully, lovingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's going to want me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?... Oh baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's ever going to want me? Nobody  will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you are... one of the most...  incredible, bravest, most beautiful  woman I have ever met. The efforts  you make. Your courage and your  dignity. (laughs thru tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where you got it? I  honestly don't know how I would have  handled all this if I were you. Grace is so grateful, they cling to each other even harde As the tears subside, Grace manages to admit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... about what I said. It's  just that -- all those times you  and Daddy were trying for another  kid, I... I used to pray at night that  it would work. And not because of  you guys or that I wanted a brother  or sister... but... just so I wouldn't  have to be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So special. Because I was the only  one. You both wanted me to be so  good at everything, so perfect and  I wasn't. I was just me. And now I've  completely ruined everything,  anyway... They both start crying again as Annie rocks her gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sshhh... Ssshhhh... They hold each other as if for dear life... LATER -- CAMERA PANS to discover mother and daughter, fas asleep, in each other's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom sits alone, writing at his desk. His music is playing He stops to look out the window overlooking the Creek Hou Annie and Grace fell asleep with the lights still on in t living room. Tom is thinking of Grace and Annie -- wondering what happ after he left... conflicted by what he feels for Annie... remembering why they're here in the first place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings, awakening Annie first, then Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, this is ATT Conference Service.  Is this Annie MacLean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a conference call scheduled for  you with Mr. Gottschalk and Mr. Farlow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh, yes. One moment, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, nothing. I'm going to pick it up  in the other room -- would you hang  this up for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Annie moves to the other room, sits down at her office sp takes a breath, then picks up, yelling to Grace;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Grace... (click)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Operator?... I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie and Grace are standing by the arena fence. Frank, J and the Twins are sitting on the fence rail. Joe is holdi saddle and a bridle, standing in some shadows in an empty arena. Pilgrim comes running into the ring. Out of habit, starts circling the ring. He sees Tom holding a saddle.  Pilgrim walks towards him. Curious, he stops, looking at Tom puts the saddle down, sitting crossways on it. Pilgri walks towards him again. He stops, looking at Tom again. just sits there, playing with the bridle. Pilgrim walks  around him. Tom doesn't show him any interest. Pilgrim co closer. He looks at the saddle. He runs off. He stops,  looking back. Tom just sits. Pilgrim walks back over. Tom stands and shows him the bridle. Pilgrim comes closer,  sniffing it. He rubs his nose against the leather. Tom pa his head. Then, in one quick, but deft motion, he puts th bridle on him. Pilgrim tosses his head, but it doesn't se to bother him. Grace and Annie watch intently. Tom takes reins, walking Pilgrim around the ring. He walks him to t saddle. Pilgrim paws at it with his hoof. He turns and ru off. Tom lets him go. Pilgrim runs around the ring, slows down, looks over at Tom. Tom picks up the saddle. Pilgrim cautiously, comes back over. Tom, with the saddle, walks from him. Pilgrim, again curious, follows him. He nudges Tom stops. Pilgrim comes around to take a good look at th saddle. Tom rubs his back. And gently, like laying down a sheet, puts the saddle on his back. Pilgrim shuffles slig at the touch. Tom quickly cinches it. Taking up the reins walks Pilgrim around the ring again. He starts to jog.  Pilgrim jogs with him. And in the middle of the jog, Tom  grabs onto the saddle horn, and without breaking his stri pulls himself back up onto his back. He lays across the  saddle, letting Pilgrim feel his weight. He sits up, and  without letting him break his stride, he urges Pilgrim wi his thighs, keeping him in the jog, riding around the rin Grace and Annie cheer. Tom tips his hat to them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace is cleaning stalls, etc... She exits one of the sta with a pail and stops -- looking down the barn to where s knows Pilgrim is. She places the pail down and gathers he courage. She walks to Pilgrim's stall. She stands motionl for some moments before she opens the doors and enters... Pilgrim steps back a bit. He looks at her. He pins his ea back. Stomps his feet. Grace is about to turn and leave, she stops herself and remains still. Slowly, she reaches out to touch Pilgrim's head... and he lets her. We see in Grace a maturity of character, a  willingness to face what she must face... the beginning o compassion, not only for Pilgrim, but perhaps for herself well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full moon lights the ranch. Tom pulls up to the ranch h in his truck, parks and gets out. As he walks towards the house, he hears: Grace exits the Creek House and coming towards him, a coa over her nightgown. Tom waits until she reaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was waiting for you to come back. Tom instinctively knows what she wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace sits at the table. Tom is cooking at the stove. It as if they are the only two people on earth. Grace gets u nerve... and begins:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judith was telling me about this boy  she really liked. She never even had  a chance to tell me his name... She starts to quietly cry, but it doesn't stop her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were going to go around by the  railroad bridge... And we see the accident all over again... But this time, movie -- as clear as reality -- but in deathly silence. J the sound of Grace's voice, and her heartbeat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horses are going up the icy path...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were laughing about something, I  don't remember what. Her horse fell... Judith's horse suddenly stumbles on the ice, going down,  throwing Judith, her foot helplessly caught in the stirru Her horse sliding back down the hill. Grace tries to move Pilgrim to avoid the errant horse, bu it's too late, the horse plows into them, the horses slid back down the hillside onto the empty COUNTRY ROAD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilgrim is first to find his legs. Judith's horse, its le broken at the ankle, walks in a confused state. Judith's is helplessly caught in the stirrup...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Judith's foot was caught in the  stirrup... she couldn't get up, she  was so scared... (cries)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw this truck, coming around the  turn... She sees the glint of the steel. The Truck suddenly appea from around the bend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He was honking, trying to get us to  move... I tried to grab the reins to  get Judith's horse out of the way... Grace grabs the reins of Judith's horse. The horses are  spooking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And the truck started skidding... The truck skidded on the icy road, going out of control, knifing, heading right for them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It was coming right at us... There  wasn't any time to do anything... It  ran right into Judith's horse... The truck bed plows into Judith's horse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Judith just disappeared... And it  came right at Pilgrim and me... We see this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And Pilgrim reared up at the truck  and I fell off... Grace falls onto the road, the truck running over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace sobs uncontrollably now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judith... Oh God, Judith. I'm sorry... Tom is near and holds her as she puts her head on his che

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't tell you it'll stop feeling  this bad... But I can tell you, you  didn't do anything wrong... The same  thing would have happened to me... or  Frank... or Joe... And there's no  sense in looking for a reason why  things happen... (self-reflective)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to try and... always came up  short. I don't think the why so's  important as... what we do with what  we get. I remember this boy I'd see  up on the Blackfeet Reservation. He  was sixteen. Great kid. Strong. He'd  gone swimming and dived headfirst into  a rock. Snapped his neck, paralyzed  him... After the accident, I'd look  in on him from time to time... and he  wasn't there anymore. His mind, his  spirit, whatever you want to call it,  it just disappeared. And what was left  was nothing but anger... It's like the  boy I knew just went away somewhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you do. Don't you disappear. (holds her tighter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do whatever you have to, to hold  on... (thinks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you one more thing... When  Pilgrim reared up to face that  truck... you know what I think?... I  think that damn horse loved you so much,  he was trying to protect you... That's  what I think. Grace listens to this. As Tom holds her in silence, it's  almost as if they were father and daughter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom stands with Grace in the corral. Tom's horse, Rimrock saddled nearby. Tom takes Grace's cane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me hold that... Grace stands, looking at the horse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't... not yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no hurry. Take you time. She's trying so hard to be brave. After a moment, she rea for the saddle horn. She puts her prosthetic leg in the  stirrup, takes a breath and swings her leg up -- slipping falling to the ground. Tom doesn't say anything. She pull herself back up. She repeats the action... determinedly. swings her leg over again and sits squarely on the horse. remains still, but proud. As the day breaks, we leave them in silence -- Tom standi hands in pocket... Grace sitting up on the horse, proudly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Endless sky. Annie is jogging off in the distance when sh looks up and stops to see: Tom and Grace, both on horses, stopped on a rolling hill. They do not see her. Annie is filled with emotion... pride for her daughter,  gratitude for this amazing man. As the two ride off into the distance we do a slow:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Diane, with the Twins, dogs at their heels, rid front of the herd. Behind them, Joe riding alongside Grac Smokey and some Hands ride among the herd, keeping them m And riding behind the herd are Annie and Tom...

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS MOMENTS THROUGHOUT THE DAY DURING THE
dialogues.text: DRIVE... Highlighting, in particular, those in which the sexual tension between Tom and Annie is apparent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cattle stands in silhouette. We hear singing. Everyone is sitting around a campfire. Frank's playing th guitar, singing along with Tom. They laugh when a lyric o note goes wrong. Everyone is enjoying it. Annie, her arms around her knees, sits off by herself. Th song ends and people applaud. Frank hands the guitar to Hank;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play that sweet one you know. The one  makes my wife here so friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slaps his shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! Hank begins to play and sing a painfully pretty song. His sweet voice is stark contrast to his gruff, strongman  appearance. Frank offers his hand to Diane, she slaps it and laughs, he helps her up and they start to dance. As  everyone watches... Joe stands and offers his hand to Grace;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't want to dance with me,  would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't thinks you'd want me tripping  all over you in front of everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweetly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't let happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (affectionately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're a good kid. Joe smiles and helps her up. They come together and start dancing. Annie is watching, holding her breath with gratitude. Tom notices Annie off by herself and crosses to her. He  extends his hand. She hesitates, looks again to Grace wit Joe, then accepts... His hand slide to her back. Her hand to his shoulder. The dance. Their bodies closer than they've ever been. Slowly she leans her head against his body. And surrenders, for moment... Diane sees them. She holds her husband fast, and buries h head on his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE CATTLE DRIVE MANTAGE -- Taking Tom and Annie a bit  further in their intimacy; perhaps Tom takes extra specia care to explain things to Annie, or fix her saddle cinch, make her laugh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cows stands in the pasture, grazing. Annie and Diane cleaning some pots and pans in the stream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be nice for you to take a few  days off from your work, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I have more than a few days, ha,  ha... I uh... I'm sort of... not an  editor anymore... right now... First  time I've said it out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fired you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's more like a leave of- (stops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha, ha, ha. Yeah, they fired me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem to upset?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delayed shock. Or maybe not. I know  I could talk my way back if I wanted  or... go to another magazine,  someplace... Just not sure if I want  to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess you don't have to figure it out  until you go home. This phrase "go home" stings Annie -- though Diane said i innocently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you always know this was the life  you wanted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell in love. After that, I never  thought about being anything but a  rancher's wife. I never saw it like I  was losing some other life, just felt  like I was gaining one. I know that's  not a popular opinion nowadays and I  ain't saying it's the right one. We  all have to find the life meant for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's a good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't come better. But I don't  deny there are times I wonder about  things I won't have. Maybe one day I'll  get to see Egypt. Maybe not. But I know  if you try too many different lives,  you can wind up with no life at all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like something Tom would say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it does. Annie and Diane resume washing the dishes in silence. Ann deep in thought. Until Diane stops. After a beat, Annie  notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, I'm not good at this kind of talk  -- goes round and round a thing but  never comes to it -- so let's just say  what it is. When you first came here,  I didn't like you and I was worried. Tom  means a lot to me and this family. Don't  go looking here for whatever you looking  for. Don't make that man go through  something it took him a long time to see  his way clear out of the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think anybody can make Tom do  anything he didn't want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a good man, Tom is. He's got a  gift, come from heaven above, I swear.  But he's still a man. And a woman can  lead a man into the middle of a mountain  lake -- and still make him think he's on  dry land. Diane's words ring in Annie's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead in stillness. The cattle dark and motionless. Everyo asleep in bedrolls around the pasture. Annie awakens, looks up at the moon, watching it go in an out of the clouds. She looks over to sleeping Grace... Th looks to where Tom is -- and sees his sleeping bag is emp Quietly, she rises and looks for him. She starts across the grass and sees him crossing on his  haunches, wearing a slicker, sitting in the grass by the  stream, drinking some water. She watches him. Tom senses something and turns. For a moment, they just l at each other -- half disbelieving the inevitable is so c at hand. Annie approaches as Tom rises. They meet. They kiss. Tentative at first, but more, just make that very, precious first moment of discovery last a long as it can. The kiss grows more passionate. They begi lose themselves in each other. Until, suddenly, aware of their surroundings, they part. words. Their expressions to each other tell all. Annie  separates herself and goes back to her bedroll... Tom sta in the grass, by the stream... the moving water, the nigh only sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cattle drive returns. Tom, Annie, Grace, et al... are their horses, heading back towards the ranch when Grace s in the distance;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? Annie looks up and sees: POV -- ROBERT has come to the ranch. He is waiting for th with his luggage beside a rental car... standing out like Like The Man In The Gray Flannel Suit in the middle of  Wyeth's "Christina's World."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is being introduced to Robert, as Grace hugs him from the side, never letting go of him. Frank, Diane -- w introduce their kids, then Tom and Robert shake hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mr. Booker, Robert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extends hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. It's a pleasure. I'm very grateful  for the way you took in my girls here.  I bet you were surprised when they  just showed up out of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah... Laugh. Awkward silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I uh... I can already see a change. (hugging Grace)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm very grateful to you. Robert is so sincere -- in that openly, modern, "express feelings" kind of way. Tom just nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you notice -- no cane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we show him Pilgrim, Tom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, we're gonna show your dad plenty.  Why don't you all get settled in and  we'll do the tour. Excuse me. As Tom walks away, a nervous Robert feels compelled to sa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later! Tom just nods and keeps walking. Annie and Robert face ea other for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's bring your bags inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait till you see this -- we have the  whole house to ourselves... The MacLean walk to the Creek House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, we see the pick-up truck parked out in t pasture. Tom is standing with Robert -- in jeans, now -- Grace, telling Robert about the ranch. Robert has his arm around Grace, asking questions, interested in everything. Grace is loving being with her two favorite men...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace waits in the truck as Tom leads Robert through the and cowshit, climbs up and hops over a wood fence. Robert follows suit -- not as gracefully -- and gets a splinter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane is busy in the kitchen when Annie enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything you need? I'm going  food-shopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I am going to go after lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I'll go -- just give me a  list. Annie is determined. She needs to be by herself for a bit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom continues his tour as the dogs run about them. Tom pa the dogs no attention, except to bark an order. Robert,  however, engages with them -- picking up a stick and thro it. A dog returns and gives it back. Robert kneels and be rubbing the dog's fur, talking to it, looking like an  anachronism in his baggy jeans with designer cowboy belt spanking new designer cowboy boots. Tom waits patiently for Robert, who... and carries on wit the dog a bit too long. When Robert gets up, he habituall brushes the dirt off his jeans, maybe even his boots, and makes sure his outfit is hanging properly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace is in the stall with Pilgrim. Once again, close eno to touch him, which he allows. Outside the stall, stand Robert and Tom. Robert squeezes splinter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it's the same horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still have a way to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much longer do you think? Tom understands this man wants his family back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, like I told your wife, it's  really up to Pilgrim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is seated around the table, eating, talking, lau Grace is right by her father's side. Frank's in the middl telling Robert:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thought we lost him in the snow  storm... Told the kids. Had a funeral  for the damn thing. Finally, snow  stops. Staring to warm up. I go out  and start cleaning the truck...  Goddamn if that dog doesn't jump out  from the back seat covered in snow...  I nearly stained myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thought it was a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dog ghost! Laughter all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is outside enjoying the night after a long day. Diane and Annie are on the porch. Diane is showing Annie she does her needlepoint. Annie is genuinely interested. Tom and Frank and Robert are sitting out front. Grace is Robert's feet. Joe sits on the ground in front of his fat opposite Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the poverty worse, now, you  think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been back in over twenty  years, but I wouldn't be surprised.  The population's larger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing over in India?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, this was right after college. I  was in the Peace Corps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That right? Back on Diane and Annie, who hear the laughter O.S. and l Diane smiles, seeing how much Grace is enjoying her dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sure loves her daddy, huh? Annie smiles and looks herself. Yes, she does, she thinks can't I? Back to the others. Everyone is very interested in Robert stories... especially Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and I thought before I settled  into law school -- everybody knew that  was the plan -- I'd take this time for  myself. Grace rises to go to the Creek House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I tell you, Frank, it was one of  the -- As Grace passes by, she stumbles a bit and Robert habitua rises to help, but Grace ignores him and rights herself,  continuing. Robert quickly sits back down, continuing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... one of the uh... greatest times  of my life... I had experiences that,  I think, changed my outlook forever.  I came back a different person,  literally. Tom listens with great interest and respect. Back to Diane and Annie, who watch as Joe follows Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm going to have my hands  full with the son of mine when you  leave. Just might be his first  broken heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, how sweet. A burst of laughter pulls their attention to the group -- Robert is now standing, acting out a story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and I have no idea what he's  saying because I don't understand  Hindu... Everyone is listening, with big expectant smiles. Annie  watches -- having heard this story before. Her eyes gradu shift to Tom, who is enjoying the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... So, finally I'm trying to explain  to him that I'm allergic to wool and  would he please get his sheep out of  my car -- Laughter. Robert continues, giving a quick look to Annie who is looking at Tom... Robert lets it go, continuing hi story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace is asleep. Robert sits by her bed, lit by the moon  through a window. He stares at this creature he loves so  much. He rises and enters Annie's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired? Annie shrugs. Robert looks at the bed. He teases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small bed. Maybe I should sleep in  the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teases back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're allergic to hay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize for the surprise, but the  days only opened yesterday and I  figured...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to explain. You have  every right to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see why you put your faith in  him. He's a genuine... good guy...  Good at what he does. That's rare. Annie nods. She tries to hide her discomfort. Robert sits the bed before her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right about coming here. I'm  sorry for not thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay. Believe me, there were  plenty of times I didn't know what  the hell was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling about work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not talk about that now. And they're quiet. He moves to kiss her. It's awkward. Th look to each other -- as they try to remember how to make together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like I'm on a first date. Annie smiles sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars and pick-up trucks haphazardly parked along a dirt  road... Smoking open grill barbecues. Ranchers and famili move about the ranch, sit and eat at picnic tables with  gingham tablecloths... Some teenagers hanging around the  corral, talking. Diane and some other women, eating and  talking... Frank with a group of men, drinking beer, tell stories. A BAND has been set up by the barn. People are dancing un the harvest moon. Grace is dancing with Joe... Tom is dan with a local woman... Annie with a rancher... Everyone is having a good time... Robert is enjoying a smoke with some men. He looks over t the dance floor and smiles when he sees Grace and Joe. Joe and the Rancher trade place... Joe dances with Annie, Rancher with Grace... But Tom sees his chance and switche with the Rancher so that he can dance with Grace... She i thrilled and he guides her effortlessly across the floor. Joe and Annie are interrupted by another couple. Joe swit partners, but Annie smiles and excuses herself -- she wan rest. Robert continues talking with some of the men. He puts ou his smoke and looks over to the dance floor. He sees Grac dancing with Tom... His eyes search for Annie. He moves a from the men until he sees, from a distance; Annie, sitting by herself, amidst the crowd... No one wou notice her unless they were looking for her... But Robert -- and what he sees is Annie looking at Grace and Tom... only looking at Tom... Smiling to herself gently... Watch his every move. Suddenly, she rises and exits out of the to get some air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie finds an isolated spot, behind the main house, to b herself and catch her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Grace continue dancing. She's in heaven. Robert  approaches and Tom quickly allows him to take over. Grace loves the attention from both men. As they dance off, Tom crosses the dance floor and is met by Hank's wife;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Tom, would you check the shed and see  if there's anymore chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is walking along when he turns the corner of Hank's h and finds; Annie sitting alone, staring up at the night. They see ea other. From behind the house, no one else can see them. It is as if the fates brought them face to face and alone Without any will to stop it, they embrace and kiss  passionately. But when they look into each other's eyes,  there is no joy in the kiss. Tom releases her and walks a heading for the shed. Annie quickly pulls herself togethe and enters the main house through the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane is once more sitting at the kitchen table, looking some bills before bed. Her tape player is on softly. Tom  enters and crosses to the sink to get a glass of water. Diane looks up, seeing Tom with his back to her -- standi the sink, filling his glass -- staring out the window ove sink. She looks to the dish of brownies on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have some brownies left over. Want  one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (w/o turning around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. Diane senses an uneasiness in Tom. She looks as he drinks water. MEDIUM CLOSE-UP ON TOM'S BACK, as if from Diane's POV. But when we pull back we find ourselves;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is standing in front of Pilgrim's stall. He opens the door. They look at each other. He strokes him and begins whisper;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something you have to do  tomorrow, boy... Camera gently moves away... and Tom whispers to Pilgrim w must be done...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a stillness. A sense of import. Annie, Robert, Fr Diane, Joe and Smokey, are all at various spots along the Grace stands inside the ring. Tom is standing beside Pilg in the middle of the ring. Pilgrim is bridled and saddled Tom adjusts he stirrup. He walks over to Grace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All set? Grace swallows hard, nodding. She's worried...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Tom puts his arms around her shoulders and walks out to  Pilgrim. The horse pricks up his ears as they approach. T motions Grace to stop a short distance from Pilgrim so as to crowd him. Tom walks over alone, reaching to gently ta hold of him. Holding him by the bridle, he puts his head  beside Pilgrim's, quietly speaking to him, soothing Pilgr neck with his other hand... Annie and Robert are fascinated. Anxious. Pilgrim never takes his eyes off Grace. Tom tries to ease forward. Pilgrim resists, lifting his head and looking at Grace so you can see the white at the top of his eye. Tom turns him away, walking him in circles, trying to calm hi He leads him back to Grace. Pilgrim tosses his head and  stomps his feet. Robert grows more anxious. Annie is calmer, more focused. Tom climbs up on him, riding him around the arena in an e lope. Grace watches them go round the ring. She looks at parents and tries to smile. They try as well. Tom dismounts and leads Pilgrim back to Grace. Pilgrim ba again, violently throwing his head, kicking... Grace's  shoulders slump, she presses her hands in her pockets,  fighting not to cry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smokey... Smokey climbs over the rail into the ring as Tom says som to him. Meanwhile Frank reassures Grace:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be okay, Grace. Just you hang  on there a minute or two. Tom'll get  him, okay, you'll see... Smokey jogs over to the gate, climbing it, and disappeari into the barn. Tom crosses to Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's still something going on  inside of him I can't reach. So me  and Smokey here, we're going to  try laying him down. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more or less how it sounds.  Sometimes it's not pretty to watch.  Some horses fight it real hard.  Your fella's already shown us he  likes a good fight. So if you don't  want to watch, I'll call you when it's  done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to watch. Smokey re-enters the ring, carrying some rope. He talks  briefly to Tom. Pilgrim, sensing something, turns and run the far side of the ring. Tom, his arms spread, walks ove to him, keeping him by the fence. Tom takes him by the  bridle. Smokey comes beside him. Tom unhitches the bridle in its place slips a rope halter Smokey passes to him.  Smokey then hands him two long ropes, one at a time. Tom  fastens one under the halter and ties the other to the sa horn. Tom asks Smokey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that soft rope? Smokey hands it to him. Tom quietly talks to Pilgrim, run his hand down Pilgrim's left foreleg and lifts his hoof.  Pilgrim slightly shifts. And when he's still, Tom slips t loop at the end of the soft rope over the hoof making sur it's snug. And taking the other end of the rope, he hoist weight of Pilgrim's raised hoof and ties the rope to the  saddle horn. Pilgrim stands on three legs -- an explosion waiting to happen. Tom moves away from Pilgrim, taking th halter line from Smokey. Pilgrim, trying to move, finds h crippled. Scared, he lurches, hopping on his right forele Seeing he can't walk, panicked, he tries to run. Tom and  Smokey, brace themselves, lean back on their ropes and fo him around them in a tight circle. He goes around and aro like a crazed rocking horse with a broken leg. Tom looks and sees Annie has left Robert outside the ring to stand an anguished Grace -- her hands on her shoulders, grippin her. Robert watches, feeling too much a foreigner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be OK, Grace. But even Frank isn't so sure. Pilgrim, covered in sweat,  still circles. As he runs, his hobbled foot jabs at the a trying to find peace. He runs and runs as Tom and Smokey on the ropes -- until he can't run any more and stops. To Smokey let the lines go slack. Pilgrim, stands there, his sides heaving, panting like an asthmatic, making loud ras sounds. Tom and Smokey speak. Smokey hands him his rope.  Turning, he gets a coiled lasso out of the sand. He swing the rope in a wide loop and makes it fall over Pilgrim's  saddle horn. He pulls it tight. And he takes the other en the rope to the far side of the fence and ties it in a qu release knot to the bottom rung. Coming back he takes the other two lines from Tom. Tom crosses to the rail. He sta putting pressure on the rope. Pilgrim feeing it, braces  himself. The pressure tilts the saddle hold downward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Grace and Annie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to get him to go down  on his knees... Pilgrim fights. Tom pulls on the rope. Pilgrim, slowly,  begrudgingly, gives ground. Tom, brings him to his knees, but it is short lived. Pilgrim is muscling his way back t his feet. Tom pulls him down to his knees again. Pilgrim, fighting with every bit of strength, slowly gets to his f again. But the pressure Tom is putting on the saddle is t strong and relentless and finally Pilgrim goes down on hi knees and stays down. Yet Tom keeps the pressure on... To shouts to Smokey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the lines and come help me... Smokey, dropping the line, runs over. They both pull on  the saddle rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough! Stop it! Pilgrim snorts and foams at the mouth, fighting. But  slowly, like a wounded bird, she starts giving in. He  rolls over on his side and lays his head in the sand and  is still. It seems like a total, humiliating surrender.  Grace starts to sob, burying her face in Annie's chest.  Robert feels impotent to help.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Tom and Smokey stand over the fallen horse like two big  game hunters at the carcass of a kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE! Will you come here, please! Grace shakes her head "NO." Frank motions to Annie for  her to let Grace go... to let stand alone... We see  that it's not easy for Annie to trust this, but she does. And she steps back to where Robert stands... Tom, his face set, walks toward Grace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, I need you to come with me. Grace violently shakes her head "NO"... Robert gets up th courage to say aloud:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe she shouldn't be here... Annie quickly turns to him and says with quick intensity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert! Let him handle it! Please! Robert can't watch this. He turns and takes a few steps.  Just stops... standing behind and apart from Annie, to  just watch... slowly becoming transfixed, like someone  who can't stop staring at an accident. Tom reaches Grace and puts his hand tenderly on her shoul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, I need you to come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're only going to hurt him  some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not hurt. He's okay. Look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turned away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, Listen... you've got to do this.  Just trust me one more time. Grace looks into his eyes and is reminded of all this man has done for her... and she remembers her trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what? Tom, prouder of her now than ever before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show you. Tom leads her across the ring, with his arm around her  shoulder. Annie tries to maintain her composure. Robert  remains still and focused. Tom and Grace come to Pilgrim, lying in the dirt, his  breathing plaintive. Tom speaks gently;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to lay down with him. I  want you to stroke him. I want to  start with his hindquarters and rub  him, feel him all over. Grace is shaking her head "NO." He speaks more firmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, you've got to do what I say. Grace knows there's no way out. She takes a breath and sl kneels in the dirt beside him, with Tom's help. She lays him, rubbing him, his hindquarters, his legs, his side,  softly rubbing his neck and the wet silky side of his hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, listen. I want you to stand on  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Tom responds to their voice without looking at them:

dialogues.speaker: PLEASE
dialogues.text: (they stop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, do what I'm telling you. Stand  on him... now! Grace obeys him through her tears. She lets Tom take her and guide her up onto the curve of Pilgrim's belly. Then lets go. Grace stands there with teas steaming down her  face -- standing on the animal she loved most in the worl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so cruel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He had the choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What choice!!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either fight the way things are or  accept it. Robert, however, is hypnotized by the event. He is having private epiphany of sorts. Grace sits in the dirt by Pilgrim and strokes him quietly she begins talking to him, the way Tom does. Tom watches, he cautiously steps further away. Pilgrim looks up at Gra out of the dark pool of his one sad eye. They look at eac other. And we understand there's a connection once more. moment of understanding... and forgiveness. Grace starts to untie his ropes. Smokey is about to stop but Tom shakes "NO"... Pilgrim, like an infant coming out of the water, breathin life for the first time, gets to his feet. Grace and him to each other. And all is still. Grace grabs the saddle horn. Pilgrim shuffles as if he's  going to bolt. Grace quietly reassures him... She then  carefully puts her prosthetic leg in the stirrup. Pilgrim shifts slightly. Annie covers her mouth so as not to scre out her fear. Robert breaths heavily. They watch as Grace swings her leg, determined, and pulls herself into the  saddle. Sitting on his back, Pilgrim tosses his head and  looks as he's going to run off. But Grace puts her arms  around his neck, and once again, quietly reassures him. She starts to ride him, slowly, her arms around his neck, talking all the while, around the ring. Annie laughs as she cries -- emotion overwhelming her. Ro feels almost numb with fascination, gratitude, confusion. The slow ride turns into a trot... then a lope... then a  canter... round and round the ring. Frank and Diane smile Diane looks to Tom and knows what he's feeling... Tom watches as any father would -- his heart pounding wit pride for the miracle of his child. But he doesn't let on a second. Grace brings Pilgrim to a stop, lifts her arms to the  heavens, victorious. Everyone cheers. Smokey helps her of the horse. She stops to look at Tom, who busies himself w picking up the ropes... So she re-focuses on her parents. run to each other and embrace... First, she and Annie... she and her father... But, as Robert and Grace hold each other and begins to ex Annie manages to make eye contact with Tom... and tell hi with one look, how grateful she is... and how much she lo him. And he receives it...

dialogues.speaker: WE FOLLOW THE DAYS AFTER THIS EVENT...
dialogues.text: Work on the ranch goes on as usual while Tom and Grace ke nurturing Pilgrim back to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Annie go riding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert takes an isolated hike up the mountain until he co upon a ridge overlooking an inspiring vista. We can tell  Robert is moved by the sight. Sweaty, tired, he find a pl to sit... to be still... and to consider his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's car is parked up for the trip to the airport that will take the Bookers to Branton, Missouri for Diane's  cousin's wedding... Grace, Annie and Robert are outside saying goodbye to the Bookers; Diane, the Twins... and Joe... Joe awkwardly sha her hand... then removes his hat and puts it on her head. Everyone laughs. They want to hug each other, but don't k if they would... Frank and Tom are packing the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Frank, don't forget the wedding  present -- it's behind the door in  the laundry room. (to Robert and Annie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got her a pasta maker from the  catalogue... Not that they'll know  what to do with it in Branton,  Missouri... Probably use it as a  planter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's touchy about his cousins. (they laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was nice to meet you, Mr.  MacLean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same here, Mrs. Booker. Thank you  again for all your kindness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... Diane turns to Annie. Robert instinctively steps away, sa goodbye to Joe and the boys... The two women look at each other with respect and concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, are you sure you want to drive  that horse back yourself? There are  plenty of people 'round here who do  that sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already know the way... and it's  not like I have a job I have to rush  home for. (Diane nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between you and me, I could use the  time alone. Diane understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'll be all right by yourself  here, (referring to Robert and Grace)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: after they've gone? Tom hears this bit of info as he passes by with the weddi present and puts it in the truck. Annie makes sure to ave her look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just one night. If I get  uncomfortable, I'll go over to  Hanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (double meaning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise. Diane just nods, knowingly. She extends her hand. The wom shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck to you, Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, Diane. They part. Diane starts giving order as she gets in the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, everybody in. Frank, we  all set... Camera wides as we hear the voices of departure... see th MacLeans waving... See Tom off by himself, waving... but  thinking of something else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the midst of packing, Annie has made dinner for Grace Robert. In the midst of eating, Robert asks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we have invited Tom over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. He said he had work to do  until late. Annie remains silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom exits with a small, leather satchel. He crosses to hi truck, tosses in the satchel, gets in and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace enters the barn to say goodbye to Pilgrim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves to his stall and opens the doors. He stands the without any fear of her. She smiles and enters. She wraps arm around his neck, pets him and whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you home... OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is being packed up. Robert is dressed for trav Annie is taping up the boxes containing her computer  equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to stay in the city or  go up to Connecticut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connecticut. I told the office I'd  work out of there next week. When are  you planning to start back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably first thing in the morning.  It's too late to start now. I'm going  to try not to do too much driving in  the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have a suggestion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Annie looks up from the box to see Robert is calmly stari at her. His demeanor is different. Something's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
