dialogues.text: You look like something's wrong. This is Robert's moment. He knows it. He takes a breath a hopes it comes out right:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you something, Annie -- I  stood there looking at what was  happening to that horse... And, I  swear, it felt like the same thing  was happening to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understa-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I have two choices. I can either  fight the way things are, or accept  them. (Annie waits; he smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I always knew I loved you more.  Didn't bother me. I always felt  lucky... a little amazed... that such  a vibrant, beautiful woman would want  to be with a man like me... And I  guess I thought as long as I did  everything right -- if I was the best  husband I could be, the best father...  even being a good lawyer only mattered  to me because of what it meant for  us... if I could do all that, it  wouldn't make any difference if we  loved each other the same or not...  I wasn't asking for more. I told myself  I didn't need more. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't know how you feel about  me. You don't know... if you want a  life with me anymore... (bravely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don't want you to come home  until you do know... (the hard part)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... one way or the other. Annie cannot remember a time when she ever loved her husb more than in this moment -- knowing what it took for him say this. She would not disrespect it with denials. Her  throat is choked with tears, she swallows down. She nods. Robert nods, feeling both pride and heartbreak in the sam moment. He picks up his bag, kisses her goodbye and exits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie and Robert walk towards the car to find Grace, lean against it -- looking depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, honey? Gonna miss  Pilgrim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom's gone. Both Robert and Annie are surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smokey told me he left last night to  look at some horses in Sheriden. He  won't be back for three days. I can't  believe he didn't want to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hiding her own distress)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... honey... you know... that's  just not his way. Maybe you can write  him a letter or something. Say thank  you... Don't think about it... You  take care and I'll see you home. She embraces Grace and, over her shoulder, watches Robert enter the car. Grace follows suit. The car drives off lea Annie alone at the Double Divide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ranch is still. Annie stands on the porch, her arms  folded, vulnerable, looking at the ranch. All her boxes a packed and stacked in the room. She looks over to the Ran House... to Tom's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light goes on. Annie enters, cautiously. She's never be in this room. She crosses to the desk, touches it. She  notices a tape player and pushes it on. MUSIC PLAYS... Sh sees a small framed photo -- of Tom's son, years ago. Suddenly, she feels like an intruder. She shuts the music and exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie faces Pilgrim... she gently lifts her hand and care his face. He returns her gentleness. Annie is remembering Robert's words, her heart is heavy with conflict. She jok

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I get the feeling you know  what I should do, but you're not  telling me? She hears a truck pull up... Then, a door open and close. heart races...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie exits the barn and sees: Tom, walking away from the truck with the headlights left on... is walking right towards her. Annie begins moving towards him, When they meet:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't apologize for this. And I  won't hide it. Not for anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't ask you to. He takes her in his arms and they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom leads Annie to the front door. She waits as he unlock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom leads her to his room. Annie cups his grasp on her wi both hands. He opens the door for her, ushers her in, the closes the door. He hangs his hat. She turns to him. They embrace, surrendering to each other's passions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera pas from Tom's window, bright with dawn, past his  desk upon which his classical music is playing, over to t two lovers in bed, kissing and embracing. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, what are we going to do?  I'm supposed to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ssshhh... (she stops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand still, Annie. Takes what we've  got, just for now. Can you do that? Beat. She nods. The permission Tom is giving her acts lik great burden being lifted, and for the time being, she  surrenders and accepts the gift of what they feel. They k

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the ranch must continue, Tom and Annie move through day of ranch chores -- -- TOM AND ANNIE CLEANING STALLS AND FEEDING THE HORSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Annie, their horses packed with gear, ride across high mountain pasture through the grazing cattle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie and Tom sit overlooking a breathtaking view. Tom is showing her the rope trick... She looks down at their tou fingers and he gently pulls the rope away, still knotted, without ever breaking their touch... Annie looks into his eyes, understanding what this means, raises his hand to h mouth and kisses it. She looks up at him with a curious  expression;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie lays asleep in Tom's arms, under a blanket. He pick another blanket with his free hand and shimmies it under head, laying her down. She snuggles with the blanket and  keeps sleeping. Tom takes a moment to look at her as she sleeps, gently  brushing her hair away from her eyes. He's deeply in love with this woman and wants to keep her with him. But there a sad resignation in his look. A confusion. He rises and walks to a stream nearby. He bends down to t some water when he hears something. He looks up and sees the other side: A WILD HORSE giving birth to a foal in the tall grass. An WHITE STALLION steps in between Tom and the mare, as if  protecting her. Tom rises slowly to his feet. Then stands stock still. He the Stallion penetrate each other. Suddenly this beautiful, powerful Stallion rears -- viole Tom remains still, but clearly the horse is treating him an invader... It's as if the Whisperer is now being guided by the Horse towards understanding. As Tom receives it, he remembers;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summers are short here, Annie. There  isn't much of a fall. Before you know  it, the roads are closed... the nights  get long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care! We'd be together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two people can't just be alone together  in the world. At least not us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this. I can't leave you... Voice-Overs have carried over into a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Annie make love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't. But there is a difference in their lovemaking. There's a  slowness, a reverence... a sense of two people so bounded they are outside of time... Their love is so strong it al feels like despair -- their need to connect has gone beyo their bodies and into their spirits, for which there is n earthly satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun has risen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie awakens in bed and discovers she is alone. She look around for Tom. She rises and enters the other room to  discover: All her boxes and all her luggage have been removed. Her heart sinks. Tom re-enters, fully dressed, to get the last box. He sees on her face a look of confusion and hur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured, whenever you decided to  go, you'd be all set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How thoughtful of you. And what if  I decide not to go? Tom doesn't know how to respond. He looks away and bends to reach for the box when Annie commands:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone! Beat. They stand awkwardly for a moment, until;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleadingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, please... Tom reaches to embrace her, but Annie attacks him. Punchi his chest... pulling at his shirt as Tom tries to put his arms around her...

dialogues.speaker: THIS
dialogues.text: Tom's heart is breaking as he manages to get his arms aro her and hold her... as she breaks down and softly, the ra passes... Annie speaks softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know any other way, Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more adamant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Suddenly;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is easy for me!? Annie is struck by the powerful sincerity of his words;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just happened this way sometimes.  I can't explain it. But I look at you  and see Grace and I see Robert, and  no matter what you decide about him,  I just know this is right. Your life  isn't here and you know it. Annie looks into his eyes and asks, softly defiant;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what have we been doing? I mean  what was the point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused by her question)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point was to love each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? As if there has to be a result... Tom looks at her and sa with an almost innocent conviction:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we had to... And I'll never  stop loving you, Annie. Here. Where  my life is. The simplicity, and truth, of it hits Annie strongly. Annie releases herself from him and turns away... despond Realizing the utter truth and inevitability of what he sa She starts shaking her head. Tom can't hear it... He reac for her;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie... She turns back into his arms and they kiss passionately.. holding each other... as if for the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is escorting Pilgrim into the trailer attached to the Suburban. He looks across the ranch to see the figure of  Annie, standing alone, perfectly still, in the pasture,  looking out to the horizon... (reminiscent of Tom earlier the film)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom approaches Annie from behind, stopping a few feet awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie? She doesn't answer... as if she has found her own private place within her, at last... A place of strength. She loo if she knows what must be done... She hears him about to away when she asks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we go for one more ride? Tom stops. Considers this. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I'll saddle them up. He exits. Not seeing the tears in Annie's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom enters the barn slowly. He crosses to Rimrock's stall then stops. As if he is waiting. As if he knows... Then... he hears the sound of Annie's Suburban starting u looks up and knows she's leaving. He waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide angle of Annie driving away in the Suburban with the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie doesn't look back -- her eyes wet with tears -- but sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom lowers his head. It is not his way to say goodbye. An is moved by Annie's knowing. EXT. HIGHWAYS & ROADS ACROSS AMERICA - DAYS & NIG A MONTAGE of images of Annie traveling home... Across different terrains, we see Annie driving -- missin Tom... thinking of what she will decide by the time she g home. Remembering IMAGES OF TOM: -- Riding on Rimrock and tipping his hat to her... -- Sitting in the pasture, staring at Pilgrim. Ignoring h -- Seeing her arrive at the ranch for the very first time

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie drives, she continues remembering... -- She and Tom in the branding... -- She and Tom dancing around the camp fire at the cattle -- She and Tom kissing in secrecy behind Hank's house the of the barn dance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie continues driving and remembering; -- Annie and Tom coming towards each other that first nig after everyone had left the ranch... -- Tom opening the front door to the ranch house... SUDDENLY WE;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A much younger Annie waits, surrounded by luggage, as A D OPENS revealing a much younger, more vital, very handsome Robert:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Um, there doesn't seem to be any  hotel room available and someone told  me to come here and ask for "Tubab"  who might to have a place for me to  stay. Are you "Tubab"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I am a "tubab."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tubab means white man. Annie is first surprised, then embarrassed but Robert see charming and his smile breaks into a laugh, that she just and laughs herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over a meal, Robert talks excitedly of his experiences. A is captivated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Annie and Robert have made love, Robert sleeps with arms wrapped around Annie. She lies awake, feeling safe a loved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie stands where she stood when she and Grace stopped h their way to Montana... She removes from her pocket the KNOTTED LOOP he made for and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car is driving up the driveway to the house. It stops. Robert and Grace get out as Annie exits from the front do She looks beautiful -- but in a completely different way ever before. There is a calm center to her. A softness an strength. She smiles and walks to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I miss you. You look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Robert)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. They kiss as Grace watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was the trip okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm. I made good time. (to Grace)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilgrim's in the back. I found a new  stable, but they can't take him until  tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead... Grace exits excitedly O.C. Annie and Robert face each oth Robert doesn't know what to expect... but he softens when smiles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have so much to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to take a walk with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Let's just go and...  we'll see... Annie nods. He reaches for her hand, and Annie gives it  willingly... They begin to walk away from Camera... toget Annie begins to speak, telling him what we already know. he will react or what will happen, is unknown. But these people will no longer avoid their life together... someho they will make the effort to face it together. As Camera Widens, we see included in the frame, Grace and Pilgrim... as she strokes him and whispers in his ear... leads him for a walk...
